/.github/dependabot.yml:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | version: 2
 2 | updates:
 3 |   # Rust dependencies (Cargo)
 4 |   - package-ecosystem: "cargo"
 5 |     directory: "/"
 6 |     schedule:
 7 |       interval: "weekly"
 8 |       day: "monday"
 9 |       time: "09:00"
10 |       timezone: "Europe/Istanbul"
11 |     open-pull-requests-limit: 10
12 |     labels:
13 |       - "dependencies"
14 |       - "rust"
15 |     commit-message:
16 |       prefix: "cargo"
17 |       include: "scope"
18 |     pull-request-branch-name:
19 |       separator: "-"
20 |     groups:
21 |       tauri-ecosystem:
22 |         patterns:
23 |           - "tauri*"
24 |         update-types:
25 |           - "minor"
26 |           - "patch"
27 |       serde-ecosystem:
28 |         patterns:
29 |           - "serde*"
30 |         update-types:
31 |           - "minor"
32 |           - "patch"
33 |     ignore:
34 |       - dependency-name: "tauri"
35 |         update-types: ["version-update:semver-major"]
36 | 
37 |   # NPM dependencies
38 |   - package-ecosystem: "npm"
39 |     directory: "/"
40 |     schedule:
41 |       interval: "weekly"
42 |       day: "wednesday"
43 |       time: "09:00"
44 |       timezone: "Europe/Istanbul"
45 |     open-pull-requests-limit: 10
46 |     versioning-strategy: "auto"
47 |     labels:
48 |       - "dependencies"
49 |       - "npm"
50 |     commit-message:
51 |       prefix: "npm"
52 |       include: "scope"
53 |     pull-request-branch-name:
54 |       separator: "-"
55 |     groups:
56 |       tauri-js-bindings:
57 |         patterns:
58 |           - "@tauri-apps/*"
59 |         update-types:
60 |           - "minor"
61 |           - "patch"
62 |       dev-dependencies:
63 |         dependency-type: "development"
64 |         update-types:
65 |           - "minor"
66 |           - "patch"
67 | 
68 |   # GitHub Actions updates
69 |   - package-ecosystem: "github-actions"
70 |     directory: "/"
71 |     schedule:
72 |       interval: "monthly"
73 |       day: "monday" 
74 |       time: "09:00"
75 |       timezone: "Europe/Istanbul"
76 |     open-pull-requests-limit: 5
77 |     labels:
78 |       - "dependencies"
79 |       - "github-actions"
80 |     commit-message:
81 |       prefix: "github-actions"
82 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/.github/workflows/audit.yml:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | name: Audit
 2 | 
 3 | on:
 4 |   schedule:
 5 |     - cron: '0 0 * * *'
 6 |   push:
 7 |     branches:
 8 |       - develop
 9 |     paths:
10 |       - "**/Cargo.lock"
11 |       - "**/Cargo.toml"
12 |       - ".github/workflows/audit.yml"
13 |   pull_request:
14 |     branches:
15 |       - develop
16 |     paths:
17 |       - "**/Cargo.lock"
18 |       - "**/Cargo.toml"
19 |       - ".github/workflows/audit.yml"
20 | 
21 | concurrency:
22 |   group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
23 |   cancel-in-progress: true
24 | 
25 | jobs:
26 |   audit:
27 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
28 |     permissions:
29 |       issues: write
30 |       checks: write
31 |     steps:
32 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
33 |       - uses: rustsec/audit-check@v2
34 |         with:
35 |           token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/.github/workflows/clippy.yml:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | name: Clippy
 2 | 
 3 | on:
 4 |   push:
 5 |     branches:
 6 |       - develop
 7 |     paths:
 8 |       - "**/*.rs"
 9 |       - "**/Cargo.toml"
10 |       - ".github/workflows/clippy.yml"
11 |   pull_request:
12 |     branches:
13 |       - develop
14 |     paths:
15 |       - "**/*.rs"
16 |       - "**/Cargo.toml"
17 |       - ".github/workflows/clippy.yml"
18 | 
19 | concurrency:
20 |   group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
21 |   cancel-in-progress: true
22 | 
23 | jobs:
24 |   fmt:
25 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
26 | 
27 |     steps:
28 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
29 |       - uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
30 |         with:
31 |           components: rustfmt
32 |       - run: cargo fmt --all -- --check
33 | 
34 |   clippy:
35 |     strategy:
36 |       fail-fast: false
37 |       matrix:
38 |         platform: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest]
39 | 
40 |     runs-on: ${{ matrix.platform }}
41 | 
42 |     steps:
43 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
44 |       - uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
45 |         with:
46 |           components: clippy
47 |       - name: install webkit2gtk
48 |         if: matrix.platform == 'ubuntu-latest'
49 |         run: |
50 |           sudo apt-get update
51 |           sudo apt-get install -y webkit2gtk-4.1
52 |       - uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2
53 |       - name: Run clippy
54 |         env:
55 |           RUSTFLAGS: "-D warnings"
56 |         run: cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/.github/workflows/test.yml:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | name: Test
 2 | 
 3 | on:
 4 |   push:
 5 |     branches:
 6 |       - develop
 7 |   pull_request:
 8 |     branches:
 9 |       - develop
10 | 
11 | concurrency:
12 |   group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
13 |   cancel-in-progress: true
14 | 
15 | jobs:
16 |   test:
17 |     strategy:
18 |       fail-fast: false
19 |       matrix:
20 |         platform: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest]
21 | 
22 |     runs-on: ${{ matrix.platform }}
23 | 
24 |     steps:
25 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
26 |       - uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
27 |       - name: install webkit2gtk
28 |         if: matrix.platform == 'ubuntu-latest'
29 |         run: |
30 |           sudo apt-get update
31 |           sudo apt-get install -y webkit2gtk-4.1
32 |       - uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2
33 |       - name: Run tests
34 |         env:
35 |           RUSTFLAGS: "-D warnings"
36 |         run: cargo test --all-targets --all-features

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/README.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # Tauri Plugin Cache
  2 | 
  3 | [![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://github.com/Taiizor/tauri-plugin-cache/blob/develop/LICENSE)
  4 | 
  5 | An advanced, versatile, and performance-focused disk caching solution for Tauri applications. This plugin features powerful compression support, memory caching layer, configurable time-to-live (TTL) management, automatic cleanup, and cross-platform compatibility. It enables persistent storage of data on disk for fast access and optimizes application performance through intelligent caching strategies. Working seamlessly on both desktop and mobile platforms, it significantly enhances the data management capabilities of your Tauri applications.
  6 | 
  7 | ## Features
  8 | 
  9 | - **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript typings
 10 | - **Cache Statistics**: Monitor cache usage
 11 | - **Cross-Platform**: Works on desktop and mobile
 12 | - **Optional TTL**: Set expiration times for cache items
 13 | - **Disk-based Cache**: Persistent data storage and retrieval
 14 | - **Data Compression**: Enable compression for large data items
 15 | - **Customizable Storage**: Configure where cache files are stored
 16 | - **Automatic Cleanup**: Background task to remove expired items
 17 | - **Smart Compression**: Configurable compression levels and thresholds
 18 | - **Configurable Cache Location**: Customize where cache files are stored
 19 | - **Memory Caching**: In-memory caching layer for improved performance
 20 | - **Performance Optimized**: Buffered I/O and chunked processing for large datasets
 21 | - **Multiple Compression Methods**: Choose between Zlib (fast) and LZMA2 (high ratio)
 22 | 
 23 | ## Installation
 24 | 
 25 | ### Using Tauri CLI (Recommended)
 26 | 
 27 | The easiest way to install this plugin is using the Tauri CLI, which automatically adds both Rust and JavaScript dependencies to your project:
 28 | 
 29 | ```bash
 30 | # Using npm
 31 | npm run tauri add cache
 32 | 
 33 | # Using pnpm
 34 | pnpm tauri add cache
 35 | 
 36 | # Using yarn
 37 | yarn tauri add cache
 38 | ```
 39 | 
 40 | This will:
 41 | - Add the `tauri-plugin-cache` crate to your `Cargo.toml`
 42 | - Install the `tauri-plugin-cache-api` npm package
 43 | - Set up the necessary configurations
 44 | 
 45 | ### Manual Installation
 46 | 
 47 | If you prefer to manually install the plugin, you can follow these steps:
 48 | 
 49 | #### Rust Dependencies
 50 | 
 51 | Add this plugin to your project using one of these methods:
 52 | 
 53 | ```bash
 54 | # Using cargo add
 55 | cargo add tauri-plugin-cache
 56 | ```
 57 | 
 58 | Or manually add to your `Cargo.toml` file:
 59 | 
 60 | ```toml
 61 | [dependencies]
 62 | tauri = { version = "2.5.1" }
 63 | tauri-plugin-cache = "0.1.5"
 64 | ```
 65 | 
 66 | #### JavaScript/TypeScript API
 67 | 
 68 | Add the plugin API package to your project:
 69 | 
 70 | ```bash
 71 | pnpm install tauri-plugin-cache-api
 72 | # or
 73 | npm install tauri-plugin-cache-api
 74 | # or
 75 | yarn add tauri-plugin-cache-api
 76 | ```
 77 | 
 78 | ## Setup
 79 | 
 80 | Register the plugin in your `tauri.conf.json` and/or in your Rust code:
 81 | 
 82 | ```rust
 83 | // Basic setup with default configuration
 84 | fn main() {
 85 |     tauri::Builder::default()
 86 |         .plugin(tauri_plugin_cache::init())
 87 |         .run(tauri::generate_context!())
 88 |         .expect("error while running tauri application");
 89 | }
 90 | 
 91 | // Or with custom configuration
 92 | fn main() {
 93 |     let cache_config = tauri_plugin_cache::CacheConfig {
 94 |         cache_dir: Some("my_app_cache".into()),                                  // Custom subdirectory within app's cache directory
 95 |         cache_file_name: Some("cache_data.json".into()),                         // Custom cache file name
 96 |         cleanup_interval: Some(120),                                             // Clean expired items every 120 seconds
 97 |         default_compression: Some(true),                                         // Enable compression by default
 98 |         compression_level: Some(7),                                              // Higher compression level (0-9, where 9 is max)
 99 |         compression_threshold: Some(4096),                                       // Only compress items larger than 4KB
100 |         compression_method: Some(tauri_plugin_cache::CompressionMethod::Lzma2),  // Default compression algorithm
101 |     };
102 |     
103 |     tauri::Builder::default()
104 |         .plugin(tauri_plugin_cache::init_with_config(cache_config))
105 |         .run(tauri::generate_context!())
106 |         .expect("error while running tauri application");
107 | }
108 | ```
109 | 
110 | > **Note:** When specifying `cache_dir`, it's recommended to use relative paths instead of absolute paths. The plugin will create this directory inside the app's default cache directory location. If an absolute path is provided, only the last component of the path will be used as a subdirectory name within the app's cache directory.
111 | 
112 | ## Permissions
113 | 
114 | By default all plugin commands are blocked and cannot be accessed. You must modify the permissions in your `capabilities` configuration to enable these.
115 | 
116 | See the [Capabilities Overview](https://v2.tauri.app/security/capabilities) for more information.
117 | 
118 | ### Example Capability Configuration
119 | 
120 | ```json
121 | {
122 |   "$schema": "../gen/schemas/desktop-schema.json",
123 |   "identifier": "cache-access",
124 |   "description": "Capability to access the cache functionality",
125 |   "windows": ["main"],
126 |   "permissions": [
127 |     "cache:default"
128 |   ]
129 | }
130 | ```
131 | 
132 | Then enable this capability in your `tauri.conf.json`:
133 | 
134 | ```json
135 | {
136 |   "app": {
137 |     "security": {
138 |       "capabilities": ["cache-access"]
139 |     }
140 |   }
141 | }
142 | ```
143 | 
144 | ### Default Permission
145 | 
146 | The `cache:default` permission set configures which cache features are exposed by default.
147 | 
148 | #### Granted Permissions
149 | This enables all cache operations including setting, getting, and removing cached data.
150 | 
151 | #### This default permission set includes the following:
152 | - `cache:allow-set`
153 | - `cache:allow-get`
154 | - `cache:allow-has`
155 | - `cache:allow-remove`
156 | - `cache:allow-clear`
157 | - `cache:allow-stats`
158 | 
159 | ### Permission Table
160 | 
161 | | Permission | Description |
162 | |------------|-------------|
163 | | cache:allow-set | Allows setting data in the cache |
164 | | cache:deny-set | Denies setting data in the cache |
165 | | cache:allow-get | Allows retrieving data from the cache |
166 | | cache:deny-get | Denies retrieving data from the cache |
167 | | cache:allow-has | Allows checking if data exists in the cache |
168 | | cache:deny-has | Denies checking if data exists in the cache |
169 | | cache:allow-remove | Allows removing data from the cache |
170 | | cache:deny-remove | Denies removing data from the cache |
171 | | cache:allow-clear | Allows clearing all data from the cache |
172 | | cache:deny-clear | Denies clearing all data from the cache |
173 | | cache:allow-stats | Allows retrieving statistics about the cache |
174 | | cache:deny-stats | Denies retrieving statistics about the cache |
175 | 
176 | ## Usage
177 | 
178 | ### JavaScript/TypeScript Example
179 | 
180 | ```typescript
181 | import { set, get, has, remove, clear, stats } from 'tauri-plugin-cache-api';
182 | 
183 | // Store a value with TTL
184 | await set('user', { name: 'John', age: 30 }, { ttl: 60 }); // Expires in 60 seconds
185 | 
186 | // Store a large value with compression
187 | await set('largeData', largeObject, { compress: true });
188 | 
189 | // Store a value with both TTL and compression
190 | await set('temporaryData', data, { ttl: 300, compress: true });
191 | 
192 | // Retrieve a value (returns null if not found or expired)
193 | const user = await get<{ name: string, age: number }>('user');
194 | if (user) {
195 |   console.log(user.name); // "John"
196 | }
197 | 
198 | // Check if a key exists and is not expired
199 | const exists = await has('user');
200 | if (exists) {
201 |   console.log('User exists in cache');
202 | }
203 | 
204 | // Remove a value
205 | await remove('user');
206 | 
207 | // Get cache statistics
208 | const statistics = await stats();
209 | console.log(`Cache has ${statistics.totalSize} items (${statistics.activeSize} active)`);
210 | 
211 | // Clear all values
212 | await clear();
213 | ```
214 | 
215 | ### Rust Example
216 | 
217 | ```rust
218 | use tauri::Manager;
219 | use tauri_plugin_cache::CacheExt;
220 | 
221 | // In a command or elsewhere with access to the app handle
222 | #[tauri::command]
223 | async fn demo_cache(app_handle: tauri::AppHandle) -> Result<String, String> {
224 |     // Access the cache
225 |     let cache = app_handle.cache();
226 |     
227 |     // Store a value with TTL
228 |     let options = Some(tauri_plugin_cache::SetItemOptions { 
229 |         ttl: Some(60),
230 |         compress: None, // Use default compression setting
231 |         compression_method: None, // Use default compression method
232 |     });
233 |     cache.set("key".to_string(), "value", options).map_err(|e| e.to_string())?;
234 |     
235 |     // Store a value with compression
236 |     let compress_options = Some(tauri_plugin_cache::SetItemOptions {
237 |         ttl: None,
238 |         compress: Some(true), // Enable compression
239 |         compression_method: Some(tauri_plugin_cache::CompressionMethod::Lzma2), // Use LZMA2
240 |     });
241 |     cache.set("large_key".to_string(), large_value, compress_options).map_err(|e| e.to_string())?;
242 |     
243 |     // Get a value
244 |     let value: Option<String> = cache.get("key")
245 |         .map_err(|e| e.to_string())?
246 |         .and_then(|v| serde_json::from_value(v).ok());
247 |         
248 |     // Check if a key exists
249 |     let exists = cache.has("key").map_err(|e| e.to_string())?.value;
250 |     
251 |     // Remove a value
252 |     cache.remove("key").map_err(|e| e.to_string())?;
253 |     
254 |     // Clear all values
255 |     cache.clear().map_err(|e| e.to_string())?;
256 |     
257 |     Ok("Cache operations completed".to_string())
258 | }
259 | ```
260 | 
261 | ## API
262 | 
263 | ### JavaScript/TypeScript API
264 | 
265 | #### `set(key: string, value: any, options?: SetItemOptions): Promise<void>`
266 | 
267 | Sets an item in the cache with optional TTL and compression.
268 | 
269 | - `key`: The key to store the value under
270 | - `value`: The value to store (will be JSON serialized)
271 | - `options`: Optional settings
272 |   - `ttl`: Time-to-live in seconds (item will be deleted after this time)
273 |   - `compress`: Whether to compress the data before storing
274 |   - `compressionMethod`: Compression method to use (CompressionMethod.Zlib or CompressionMethod.Lzma2)
275 | 
276 | #### `get<T = any>(key: string): Promise<T | null>`
277 | 
278 | Gets an item from the cache.
279 | 
280 | - `key`: The key to retrieve
281 | - Returns: The stored value (type T) or null if not found or expired
282 | 
283 | #### `has(key: string): Promise<boolean>`
284 | 
285 | Checks if an item exists in the cache and is not expired.
286 | 
287 | - `key`: The key to check
288 | - Returns: True if the item exists and is not expired
289 | 
290 | #### `remove(key: string): Promise<void>`
291 | 
292 | Removes an item from the cache.
293 | 
294 | - `key`: The key to remove
295 | 
296 | #### `clear(): Promise<void>`
297 | 
298 | Clears all items from the cache.
299 | 
300 | #### `stats(): Promise<CacheStats>`
301 | 
302 | Gets cache statistics.
303 | 
304 | - Returns: An object with statistics about the cache
305 |   - `totalSize`: Total number of items in the cache
306 |   - `activeSize`: Number of active (non-expired) items
307 | 
308 | ## Compression
309 | 
310 | This plugin supports data compression to reduce the disk space used by cache items. You can enable compression for individual items or set it as the default for all cache items.
311 | 
312 | ### Compression Methods
313 | 
314 | The plugin supports multiple compression methods to optimize storage based on your specific needs:
315 | 
316 | - **Zlib**: Default method, provides a good balance between compression ratio and speed
317 | - **LZMA2**: Better compression ratio (especially for base64 encoded data), but slower compression speed
318 | 
319 | ### Benefits of Compression
320 | 
321 | - **Reduced Disk Usage**: Compresses data to save disk space
322 | - **Improved I/O Performance**: Smaller data sizes mean faster read/write operations
323 | - **Network Efficiency**: If you sync cache data over a network, compressed data reduces bandwidth usage
324 | 
325 | ### Configuration Options
326 | 
327 | You can configure the default compression behavior when initializing the plugin:
328 | 
329 | ```rust
330 | let cache_config = tauri_plugin_cache::CacheConfig {
331 |     default_compression: Some(true), // Enable compression by default
332 |     compression_level: Some(7),      // Higher compression level (0-9)
333 |     compression_threshold: Some(4096), // Only compress items larger than 4KB
334 |     compression_method: Some(tauri_plugin_cache::CompressionMethod::Lzma2), // Use LZMA2
335 |     // Other options...
336 | };
337 | ```
338 | 
339 | ### Per-Item Compression
340 | 
341 | You can override the default compression setting for individual items:
342 | 
343 | ```typescript
344 | // Force compression for this item regardless of default setting
345 | await set('largeData', largeObject, { compress: true });
346 | 
347 | // Force no compression for this item
348 | await set('smallData', smallObject, { compress: false });
349 | 
350 | // Use Zlib for faster compression
351 | await set('mediumData', mediumObject, { compress: true, compressionMethod: CompressionMethod.Zlib });
352 | 
353 | // Use LZMA2 for high compression ratio (useful for large text data)
354 | await set('largeTextData', largeText, { compress: true, compressionMethod: CompressionMethod.Lzma2 });
355 | ```
356 | 
357 | When using the compression method feature, make sure to import the `CompressionMethod` enum along with the functions you need:
358 | 
359 | ```typescript
360 | import { set, get, CompressionMethod } from 'tauri-plugin-cache-api';
361 | ```
362 | 
363 | ### Compression Method Comparison
364 | 
365 | | Method | Compression Ratio | Compression Speed | Decompression Speed | Best For |
366 | |--------|-------------------|-------------------|---------------------|----------|
367 | | Zlib   | Good              | Fast              | Fast                | General purpose, balanced performance |
368 | | LZMA2  | Excellent         | Slow              | Medium              | Base64 data, large text, maximum space saving |
369 | 
370 | Choose LZMA2 when disk space is at a premium and you don't mind slower compression times. Zlib is better for general purpose use where compression/decompression speed is important.
371 | 
372 | ## Platform Compatibility
373 | 
374 | This plugin supports both desktop and mobile platforms:
375 | 
376 | - Desktop: Windows, macOS, Linux
377 | - Mobile: Android, iOS
378 | 
379 | ## License
380 | 
381 | This project is released under the [MIT License](https://github.com/Taiizor/tauri-plugin-cache/blob/develop/LICENSE).

/android/src/main/java/CachePlugin.kt:

  1 | package app.tauri.plugin.cache
  2 | 
  3 | import android.app.Activity
  4 | import android.util.Base64
  5 | import app.tauri.annotation.Command
  6 | import app.tauri.annotation.InvokeArg
  7 | import app.tauri.annotation.TauriPlugin
  8 | import app.tauri.plugin.JSObject
  9 | import app.tauri.plugin.Plugin
 10 | import app.tauri.plugin.Invoke
 11 | import org.json.JSONObject
 12 | import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream
 13 | import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream
 14 | import java.io.File
 15 | import java.util.zip.Deflater
 16 | import java.util.zip.Inflater
 17 | import org.tukaani.xz.XZInputStream
 18 | import org.tukaani.xz.XZOutputStream
 19 | import org.tukaani.xz.LZMA2Options
 20 | 
 21 | @InvokeArg
 22 | class ConfigureRequest {
 23 |     var default_compression: Boolean? = null
 24 |     var compression_level: Int? = null
 25 |     var compression_threshold: Int? = null
 26 |     var compression_method: String? = null
 27 | }
 28 | 
 29 | @InvokeArg
 30 | class SetRequest {
 31 |   lateinit var key: String
 32 |   var value: Any? = null
 33 |   var options: SetItemOptions? = null
 34 | }
 35 | 
 36 | @InvokeArg
 37 | class SetItemOptions {
 38 |   var ttl: Long? = null
 39 |   var compress: Boolean? = null
 40 |   var compressionMethod: String? = null
 41 | }
 42 | 
 43 | @InvokeArg
 44 | class GetRequest {
 45 |   lateinit var key: String
 46 | }
 47 | 
 48 | @InvokeArg
 49 | class HasRequest {
 50 |   lateinit var key: String
 51 | }
 52 | 
 53 | @InvokeArg
 54 | class RemoveRequest {
 55 |   lateinit var key: String
 56 | }
 57 | 
 58 | @InvokeArg
 59 | class CompressionConfig {
 60 |   var enabled: Boolean = true
 61 |   var level: Int = 6
 62 |   var threshold: Int = 1024
 63 |   var method: String = "zlib"
 64 | }
 65 | 
 66 | @TauriPlugin
 67 | class CachePlugin(private val activity: Activity): Plugin(activity) {
 68 |     private var cacheDir: File
 69 |     private var defaultCompression = true
 70 |     private var compressionLevel = 6
 71 |     private var compressionThreshold = 1024 // 1KB
 72 |     private var compressionMethod = "zlib"
 73 | 
 74 |     init {
 75 |         cacheDir = File(activity.cacheDir, "tauri_cache")
 76 |         if (!cacheDir.exists()) {
 77 |             cacheDir.mkdirs()
 78 |         }
 79 |         android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Cache plugin initialized at ${cacheDir.absolutePath}")
 80 |     }
 81 | 
 82 |     @Command
 83 |     fun configure(invoke: Invoke) {
 84 |         try {
 85 |             val config = invoke.parseArgs(ConfigureRequest::class.java)
 86 |             
 87 |             if (config.default_compression != null) {
 88 |                 defaultCompression = config.default_compression!!
 89 |             }
 90 |             if (config.compression_level != null) {
 91 |                 compressionLevel = config.compression_level!!
 92 |             }
 93 |             if (config.compression_threshold != null) {
 94 |                 compressionThreshold = config.compression_threshold!!
 95 |             }
 96 |             if (config.compression_method != null) {
 97 |                 compressionMethod = config.compression_method!!
 98 |             }
 99 |             
100 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Configure: compression=$defaultCompression, level=$compressionLevel, method=$compressionMethod")
101 |             invoke.resolve()
102 |         } catch (e: Exception) {
103 |             android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "Configure error: ${e.message}")
104 |             invoke.reject("Failed to configure cache: ${e.message}")
105 |         }
106 |     }
107 | 
108 |     @Command
109 |     fun updateCompressionConfig(invoke: Invoke) {
110 |         try {
111 |             val config = invoke.parseArgs(CompressionConfig::class.java)
112 |             defaultCompression = config.enabled
113 |             compressionLevel = config.level
114 |             compressionThreshold = config.threshold
115 |             compressionMethod = config.method
116 |             
117 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Updated compression config: enabled=$defaultCompression, level=$compressionLevel, method=$compressionMethod")
118 |             invoke.resolve()
119 |         } catch (e: Exception) {
120 |             android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "Update compression config error: ${e.message}")
121 |             invoke.reject("Failed to update compression config: ${e.message}")
122 |         }
123 |     }
124 | 
125 |     @Command
126 |     fun set(invoke: Invoke) {
127 |         try {
128 |             val request = invoke.parseArgs(SetRequest::class.java)
129 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Setting cache item with key: ${request.key}")
130 |             
131 |             // Use the data - use request.value instead of invoke.data
132 |             val valueString = if (request.value != null) {
133 |                 // Check if the value is JSON
134 |                 try {
135 |                     // If it's a JSON object
136 |                     if (request.value.toString().trim().startsWith("{") || 
137 |                         request.value.toString().trim().startsWith("[")) {
138 |                         // Save in JSON format
139 |                         request.value.toString()
140 |                     } else {
141 |                         // Convert simple string values to JSON format
142 |                         "\"" + request.value.toString().replace("\"", "\\\"") + "\""
143 |                     }
144 |                 } catch (e: Exception) {
145 |                     // In case of any error, treat as simple string
146 |                     "\"" + request.value.toString().replace("\"", "\\\"") + "\""
147 |                 }
148 |             } else {
149 |                 // Empty JSON object for null values
150 |                 "null"
151 |             }
152 |             
153 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Value to save: $valueString")
154 |             
155 |             // Get TTL and compression information
156 |             val ttl = request.options?.ttl
157 |             val shouldCompress = request.options?.compress ?: defaultCompression
158 |             val compressionMethodToUse = request.options?.compressionMethod ?: compressionMethod
159 |             
160 |             // Calculate expiration time
161 |             val expiresAt = if (ttl != null) {
162 |                 System.currentTimeMillis() + (ttl * 1000)
163 |             } else {
164 |                 null
165 |             }
166 |             
167 |             // Create cache entry
168 |             val entry = JSONObject()
169 |             
170 |             // Compress data (if needed)
171 |             if (shouldCompress && valueString.length > compressionThreshold) {
172 |                 android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Compressing data (${valueString.length} bytes) with $compressionMethodToUse")
173 |                 
174 |                 // Compress the data
175 |                 val compressed = compressData(valueString.toByteArray(), compressionMethodToUse)
176 |                 
177 |                 // Encode with Base64
178 |                 val encodedString = Base64.encodeToString(compressed, Base64.NO_WRAP)
179 |                 
180 |                 entry.put("value", encodedString)
181 |                 entry.put("is_compressed", true)
182 |             } else {
183 |                 entry.put("value", valueString)
184 |                 entry.put("is_compressed", false)
185 |             }
186 |             
187 |             // Add expiration time - explicitly specify Long type to resolve type ambiguity
188 |             if (expiresAt != null) {
189 |                 entry.put("expires_at", expiresAt.toLong())
190 |             }
191 |             
192 |             // Save to file
193 |             val file = File(cacheDir, request.key)
194 |             file.writeText(entry.toString())
195 |             
196 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Cache item saved to ${file.absolutePath}")
197 |             
198 |             invoke.resolve(JSObject())
199 |         } catch (e: Exception) {
200 |             android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "Set error: ${e.message}")
201 |             e.printStackTrace()
202 |             invoke.reject("Failed to set item: ${e.message}")
203 |         }
204 |     }
205 | 
206 |     @Command
207 |     fun get(invoke: Invoke) {
208 |         try {
209 |             val request = invoke.parseArgs(GetRequest::class.java)
210 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Getting cache item with key: ${request.key}")
211 |             
212 |             val file = File(cacheDir, request.key)
213 |             
214 |             if (!file.exists()) {
215 |                 android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Cache item not found: ${request.key}")
216 |                 invoke.resolve(null)
217 |                 return
218 |             }
219 |             
220 |             // Read from file
221 |             val entryJson = JSONObject(file.readText())
222 |             
223 |             // Check expiration date
224 |             if (entryJson.has("expires_at")) {
225 |                 val expiresAt = entryJson.getLong("expires_at")
226 |                 
227 |                 if (System.currentTimeMillis() > expiresAt) {
228 |                     android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Cache item expired: ${request.key}")
229 |                     file.delete()
230 |                     invoke.resolve(null)
231 |                     return
232 |                 }
233 |             }
234 |             
235 |             // Check if compressed
236 |             val isCompressed = entryJson.optBoolean("is_compressed", false)
237 |             val value = entryJson.getString("value")
238 |             
239 |             if (isCompressed) {
240 |                 android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Decompressing cache item: ${request.key}")
241 |                 
242 |                 // Decode from Base64
243 |                 val compressedData = Base64.decode(value, Base64.NO_WRAP)
244 |                 
245 |                 // Decompress the data
246 |                 val decompressedBytes = decompressData(compressedData)
247 |                 val decompressedString = String(decompressedBytes)
248 |                 
249 |                 // Convert content to JSObject - handle JSON parsing errors
250 |                 try {
251 |                     // First check JSON format
252 |                     val trimmedValue = decompressedString.trim()
253 |                     if (trimmedValue.startsWith("{") && trimmedValue.endsWith("}") ||
254 |                         trimmedValue.startsWith("[") && trimmedValue.endsWith("]")) {
255 |                         // JSON object or array
256 |                         val result = JSObject(decompressedString)
257 |                         invoke.resolve(result)
258 |                     } else if (trimmedValue.startsWith("\"") && trimmedValue.endsWith("\"")) {
259 |                         // String value (in quotes)
260 |                         val stringValue = trimmedValue.substring(1, trimmedValue.length - 1)
261 |                         val result = JSObject()
262 |                         result.put("value", stringValue)
263 |                         invoke.resolve(result)
264 |                     } else {
265 |                         // Primitive value
266 |                         val result = JSObject()
267 |                         result.put("value", decompressedString)
268 |                         invoke.resolve(result)
269 |                     }
270 |                 } catch (e: Exception) {
271 |                     // JSON parse error - return as simple string
272 |                     android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "JSON parsing error, returning as string: ${e.message}")
273 |                     val result = JSObject()
274 |                     result.put("value", decompressedString)
275 |                     invoke.resolve(result)
276 |                 }
277 |             } else {
278 |                 // Uncompressed data - handle JSON parsing errors
279 |                 try {
280 |                     // First check JSON format
281 |                     val trimmedValue = value.trim()
282 |                     if (trimmedValue.startsWith("{") && trimmedValue.endsWith("}") ||
283 |                         trimmedValue.startsWith("[") && trimmedValue.endsWith("]")) {
284 |                         // JSON object or array
285 |                         val result = JSObject(value)
286 |                         invoke.resolve(result)
287 |                     } else if (trimmedValue.startsWith("\"") && trimmedValue.endsWith("\"")) {
288 |                         // String value (in quotes)
289 |                         val stringValue = trimmedValue.substring(1, trimmedValue.length - 1)
290 |                         val result = JSObject()
291 |                         result.put("value", stringValue)
292 |                         invoke.resolve(result)
293 |                     } else {
294 |                         // Primitive value
295 |                         val result = JSObject()
296 |                         result.put("value", value)
297 |                         invoke.resolve(result)
298 |                     }
299 |                 } catch (e: Exception) {
300 |                     // JSON parse error - return as simple string
301 |                     android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "JSON parsing error, returning as string: ${e.message}")
302 |                     val result = JSObject()
303 |                     result.put("value", value)
304 |                     invoke.resolve(result)
305 |                 }
306 |             }
307 |         } catch (e: Exception) {
308 |             android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "Get error: ${e.message}")
309 |             e.printStackTrace()
310 |             invoke.reject("Failed to get item: ${e.message}")
311 |         }
312 |     }
313 | 
314 |     @Command
315 |     fun has(invoke: Invoke) {
316 |         try {
317 |             val request = invoke.parseArgs(HasRequest::class.java)
318 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Checking cache item with key: ${request.key}")
319 |             
320 |             val file = File(cacheDir, request.key)
321 |             
322 |             if (!file.exists()) {
323 |                 val result = JSObject()
324 |                 result.put("value", false)
325 |                 invoke.resolve(result)
326 |                 return
327 |             }
328 |             
329 |             // Check expiration date
330 |             try {
331 |                 val entryJson = JSONObject(file.readText())
332 |                 
333 |                 if (entryJson.has("expires_at")) {
334 |                     val expiresAt = entryJson.getLong("expires_at")
335 |                     
336 |                     if (System.currentTimeMillis() > expiresAt) {
337 |                         android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Cache item expired: ${request.key}")
338 |                         file.delete()
339 |                         val result = JSObject()
340 |                         result.put("value", false)
341 |                         invoke.resolve(result)
342 |                         return
343 |                     }
344 |                 }
345 |             } catch (e: Exception) {
346 |                 // Ignore if file cannot be read
347 |                 file.delete()
348 |                 val result = JSObject()
349 |                 result.put("value", false)
350 |                 invoke.resolve(result)
351 |                 return
352 |             }
353 |             
354 |             val result = JSObject()
355 |             result.put("value", true)
356 |             invoke.resolve(result)
357 |         } catch (e: Exception) {
358 |             android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "Has error: ${e.message}")
359 |             invoke.reject("Failed to check item: ${e.message}")
360 |         }
361 |     }
362 | 
363 |     @Command
364 |     fun remove(invoke: Invoke) {
365 |         try {
366 |             val request = invoke.parseArgs(RemoveRequest::class.java)
367 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Removing cache item with key: ${request.key}")
368 |             
369 |             val file = File(cacheDir, request.key)
370 |             
371 |             if (file.exists()) {
372 |                 file.delete()
373 |                 android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Cache item removed: ${request.key}")
374 |             }
375 |             
376 |             invoke.resolve(JSObject())
377 |         } catch (e: Exception) {
378 |             android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "Remove error: ${e.message}")
379 |             invoke.reject("Failed to remove item: ${e.message}")
380 |         }
381 |     }
382 | 
383 |     @Command
384 |     fun clear(invoke: Invoke) {
385 |         try {
386 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Clearing all cache items")
387 |             
388 |             val files = cacheDir.listFiles()
389 |             if (files != null) {
390 |                 for (file in files) {
391 |                     file.delete()
392 |                 }
393 |                 android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Removed ${files.size} cache items")
394 |             }
395 |             
396 |             invoke.resolve(JSObject())
397 |         } catch (e: Exception) {
398 |             android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "Clear error: ${e.message}")
399 |             invoke.reject("Failed to clear cache: ${e.message}")
400 |         }
401 |     }
402 | 
403 |     @Command
404 |     fun stats(invoke: Invoke) {
405 |         try {
406 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Getting cache stats")
407 |             
408 |             val files = cacheDir.listFiles() ?: emptyArray()
409 |             var totalSize = 0
410 |             var activeSize = 0
411 |             val now = System.currentTimeMillis()
412 |             
413 |             for (file in files) {
414 |                 totalSize++
415 |                 
416 |                 try {
417 |                     val entryJson = JSONObject(file.readText())
418 |                     
419 |                     if (entryJson.has("expires_at")) {
420 |                         val expiresAt = entryJson.getLong("expires_at")
421 |                         
422 |                         if (now <= expiresAt) {
423 |                             activeSize++
424 |                         }
425 |                     } else {
426 |                         activeSize++
427 |                     }
428 |                 } catch (e: Exception) {
429 |                     // Ignore if file cannot be read
430 |                 }
431 |             }
432 |             
433 |             android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "Cache stats: total=$totalSize, active=$activeSize")
434 |             
435 |             val result = JSObject()
436 |             result.put("totalSize", totalSize)
437 |             result.put("activeSize", activeSize)
438 |             invoke.resolve(result)
439 |         } catch (e: Exception) {
440 |             android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "Stats error: ${e.message}")
441 |             invoke.reject("Failed to get stats: ${e.message}")
442 |         }
443 |     }
444 |     
445 |     // Data compression helper method
446 |     private fun compressData(data: ByteArray, method: String): ByteArray {
447 |         // Add compression markers: 1 = compressed, 1 = Zlib or 2 = LZMA2
448 |         val outputStream = ByteArrayOutputStream(data.size)
449 |         outputStream.write(1) // Compression marker
450 |         
451 |         // Check memory consumption - prevent using LZMA2 for very large data
452 |         val maxLzma2Size = 10 * 1024 * 1024 // Don't use LZMA2 for data larger than 10MB
453 |         
454 |         // Safety check - if data is too large or despite LZMA2 being requested it exceeds memory limit
455 |         // switch to Zlib which consumes less memory
456 |         val useZlib = method.toLowerCase() != "lzma2" || data.size > maxLzma2Size
457 |         
458 |         if (!useZlib) {
459 |             outputStream.write(2) // Method marker: 2 = LZMA2
460 |             
461 |             try {
462 |                 // Use settings that consume less memory for LZMA2
463 |                 val xzOutput = ByteArrayOutputStream(Math.min(data.size, 1024 * 1024)) // Max 1MB buffer
464 |                 
465 |                 // Configure LZMA2Options to reduce memory usage
466 |                 val xzEncoder = LZMA2Options(compressionLevel)
467 |                 xzEncoder.setDictSize(Math.min(1024 * 1024, data.size)) // Limit dictionary size (max 1MB)
468 |                 
469 |                 val xzOut = XZOutputStream(xzOutput, xzEncoder)
470 |                 
471 |                 // Process data in smaller chunks
472 |                 val chunkSize = 4096 // 4KB chunks
473 |                 var offset = 0
474 |                 while (offset < data.size) {
475 |                     val length = Math.min(chunkSize, data.size - offset)
476 |                     xzOut.write(data, offset, length)
477 |                     offset += length
478 |                     
479 |                     // Clear buffer
480 |                     if (offset % (512 * 1024) == 0) {
481 |                         xzOut.flush()
482 |                     }
483 |                 }
484 |                 
485 |                 xzOut.finish()
486 |                 xzOut.close()
487 |                 
488 |                 // Get compressed data
489 |                 val compressedData = xzOutput.toByteArray()
490 |                 outputStream.write(compressedData)
491 |                 
492 |                 android.util.Log.i("CachePlugin", "LZMA2 compressed ${data.size} bytes to ${compressedData.size} bytes")
493 |             } catch (e: Exception) {
494 |                 android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "LZMA2 compression error: ${e.message}")
495 |                 // Fallback to Zlib on error
496 |                 outputStream.reset()
497 |                 outputStream.write(1) // Compression marker
498 |                 outputStream.write(1) // Method marker: 1 = Zlib
499 |                 
500 |                 compressWithZlib(data, outputStream)
501 |             }
502 |         } else {
503 |             // Default Zlib compression
504 |             outputStream.write(1) // Method marker: 1 = Zlib
505 |             compressWithZlib(data, outputStream)
506 |         }
507 |         
508 |         outputStream.close()
509 |         return outputStream.toByteArray()
510 |     }
511 |     
512 |     // Put Zlib compression process in a separate method
513 |     private fun compressWithZlib(data: ByteArray, outputStream: ByteArrayOutputStream) {
514 |         val deflater = Deflater(compressionLevel)
515 |         deflater.setInput(data)
516 |         deflater.finish()
517 |         
518 |         val buffer = ByteArray(4096) // Use larger buffer
519 |         while (!deflater.finished()) {
520 |             val count = deflater.deflate(buffer)
521 |             outputStream.write(buffer, 0, count)
522 |         }
523 |         deflater.end()
524 |     }
525 |     
526 |     // Data decompression helper method
527 |     private fun decompressData(data: ByteArray): ByteArray {
528 |         if (data.isEmpty()) {
529 |             throw Exception("Empty data")
530 |         }
531 |         
532 |         // First byte indicates whether it's compressed
533 |         val isCompressed = data[0] == 1.toByte()
534 |         
535 |         if (!isCompressed) {
536 |             // Return uncompressed data directly (skip marker bytes)
537 |             return data.copyOfRange(2, data.size)
538 |         }
539 |         
540 |         // Second byte indicates compression method
541 |         val method = data[1].toInt()
542 |         
543 |         when (method) {
544 |             1 -> {
545 |                 // Zlib decompression
546 |                 val inflater = Inflater()
547 |                 inflater.setInput(data, 2, data.size - 2)
548 |                 
549 |                 val outputStream = ByteArrayOutputStream(data.size * 2)
550 |                 val buffer = ByteArray(1024)
551 |                 
552 |                 while (!inflater.finished()) {
553 |                     val count = inflater.inflate(buffer)
554 |                     outputStream.write(buffer, 0, count)
555 |                 }
556 |                 
557 |                 outputStream.close()
558 |                 inflater.end()
559 |                 
560 |                 return outputStream.toByteArray()
561 |             }
562 |             2 -> {
563 |                 // LZMA2 decompression (using XZ Utils library)
564 |                 try {
565 |                     val inputStream = ByteArrayInputStream(data, 2, data.size - 2)
566 |                     val xzIn = XZInputStream(inputStream)
567 |                     
568 |                     val outputStream = ByteArrayOutputStream(data.size * 2)
569 |                     val buffer = ByteArray(1024)
570 |                     
571 |                     var count = 0
572 |                     while (xzIn.read(buffer).also { count = it } != -1) {
573 |                         outputStream.write(buffer, 0, count)
574 |                     }
575 |                     
576 |                     xzIn.close()
577 |                     outputStream.close()
578 |                     
579 |                     return outputStream.toByteArray()
580 |                 } catch (e: Exception) {
581 |                     android.util.Log.e("CachePlugin", "LZMA2 decompression error: ${e.message}")
582 |                     throw Exception("LZMA2 decompression failed: ${e.message}")
583 |                 }
584 |             }
585 |             else -> {
586 |                 throw Exception("Unknown compression method: $method")
587 |             }
588 |         }
589 |     }
590 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/build.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1 | const COMMANDS: &[&str] = &["set", "get", "has", "remove", "clear", "stats"];
2 | 
3 | fn main() {
4 |     tauri_plugin::Builder::new(COMMANDS)
5 |         .android_path("android")
6 |         .ios_path("ios")
7 |         .build();
8 | }
9 |

1 | # Svelte + Vite
2 | 
3 | This template should help get you started developing with Tauri and Svelte in Vite.
4 | 
5 | ## Recommended IDE Setup
6 | 
7 | [VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/) + [Svelte](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=svelte.svelte-vscode) + [Tauri](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=tauri-apps.tauri-vscode) + [rust-analyzer](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=rust-lang.rust-analyzer).

10 |      */

12 |     "isolatedModules": true,
13 |     "resolveJsonModule": true,

15 |      * To have warnings / errors of the Svelte compiler at the
16 |      * correct position, enable source maps by default.
17 |      */

19 |     "esModuleInterop": true,
20 |     "skipLibCheck": true,
21 |     "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,

25 |      * Disable this if you'd like to use dynamic types.
26 |      */

28 |   },

31 |    * to avoid limiting type declarations.

   1 | {
   2 |   "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
   3 |   "title": "CapabilityFile",
   4 |   "description": "Capability formats accepted in a capability file.",
   5 |   "anyOf": [
   6 |     {
   7 |       "description": "A single capability.",
   8 |       "allOf": [
   9 |         {
  10 |           "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  11 |         }
  12 |       ]
  13 |     },
  14 |     {
  15 |       "description": "A list of capabilities.",
  16 |       "type": "array",
  17 |       "items": {
  18 |         "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  19 |       }
  20 |     },
  21 |     {
  22 |       "description": "A list of capabilities.",
  23 |       "type": "object",
  24 |       "required": [
  25 |         "capabilities"
  26 |       ],
  27 |       "properties": {
  28 |         "capabilities": {
  29 |           "description": "The list of capabilities.",
  30 |           "type": "array",
  31 |           "items": {
  32 |             "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  33 |           }
  34 |         }
  35 |       }
  36 |     }
  37 |   ],
  38 |   "definitions": {
  39 |     "Capability": {
  40 |       "description": "A grouping and boundary mechanism developers can use to isolate access to the IPC layer.\n\nIt controls application windows' and webviews' fine grained access to the Tauri core, application, or plugin commands. If a webview or its window is not matching any capability then it has no access to the IPC layer at all.\n\nThis can be done to create groups of windows, based on their required system access, which can reduce impact of frontend vulnerabilities in less privileged windows. Windows can be added to a capability by exact name (e.g. `main-window`) or glob patterns like `*` or `admin-*`. A Window can have none, one, or multiple associated capabilities.\n\n## Example\n\n```json { \"identifier\": \"main-user-files-write\", \"description\": \"This capability allows the `main` window on macOS and Windows access to `filesystem` write related commands and `dialog` commands to enable programatic access to files selected by the user.\", \"windows\": [ \"main\" ], \"permissions\": [ \"core:default\", \"dialog:open\", { \"identifier\": \"fs:allow-write-text-file\", \"allow\": [{ \"path\": \"$HOME/test.txt\" }] }, ], \"platforms\": [\"macOS\",\"windows\"] } ```",
  41 |       "type": "object",
  42 |       "required": [
  43 |         "identifier",
  44 |         "permissions"
  45 |       ],
  46 |       "properties": {
  47 |         "identifier": {
  48 |           "description": "Identifier of the capability.\n\n## Example\n\n`main-user-files-write`",
  49 |           "type": "string"
  50 |         },
  51 |         "description": {
  52 |           "description": "Description of what the capability is intended to allow on associated windows.\n\nIt should contain a description of what the grouped permissions should allow.\n\n## Example\n\nThis capability allows the `main` window access to `filesystem` write related commands and `dialog` commands to enable programatic access to files selected by the user.",
  53 |           "default": "",
  54 |           "type": "string"
  55 |         },
  56 |         "remote": {
  57 |           "description": "Configure remote URLs that can use the capability permissions.\n\nThis setting is optional and defaults to not being set, as our default use case is that the content is served from our local application.\n\n:::caution Make sure you understand the security implications of providing remote sources with local system access. :::\n\n## Example\n\n```json { \"urls\": [\"https://*.mydomain.dev\"] } ```",
  58 |           "anyOf": [
  59 |             {
  60 |               "$ref": "#/definitions/CapabilityRemote"
  61 |             },
  62 |             {
  63 |               "type": "null"
  64 |             }
  65 |           ]
  66 |         },
  67 |         "local": {
  68 |           "description": "Whether this capability is enabled for local app URLs or not. Defaults to `true`.",
  69 |           "default": true,
  70 |           "type": "boolean"
  71 |         },
  72 |         "windows": {
  73 |           "description": "List of windows that are affected by this capability. Can be a glob pattern.\n\nIf a window label matches any of the patterns in this list, the capability will be enabled on all the webviews of that window, regardless of the value of [`Self::webviews`].\n\nOn multiwebview windows, prefer specifying [`Self::webviews`] and omitting [`Self::windows`] for a fine grained access control.\n\n## Example\n\n`[\"main\"]`",
  74 |           "type": "array",
  75 |           "items": {
  76 |             "type": "string"
  77 |           }
  78 |         },
  79 |         "webviews": {
  80 |           "description": "List of webviews that are affected by this capability. Can be a glob pattern.\n\nThe capability will be enabled on all the webviews whose label matches any of the patterns in this list, regardless of whether the webview's window label matches a pattern in [`Self::windows`].\n\n## Example\n\n`[\"sub-webview-one\", \"sub-webview-two\"]`",
  81 |           "type": "array",
  82 |           "items": {

For commands directly implemented in the application itself only `${permission-name}` is required.\n\n## Example\n\n```json [ \"core:default\", \"shell:allow-open\", \"dialog:open\", { \"identifier\": \"fs:allow-write-text-file\", \"allow\": [{ \"path\": \"$HOME/test.txt\" }] } ] ```",

/examples/tauri-app/src-tauri/gen/schemas/capabilities.json:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1 | {"default":{"identifier":"default","description":"enables the default permissions","local":true,"windows":["main"],"permissions":["core:default","cache:default"]}}

/examples/tauri-app/src-tauri/gen/schemas/desktop-schema.json:

   1 | {
   2 |   "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
   3 |   "title": "CapabilityFile",
   4 |   "description": "Capability formats accepted in a capability file.",
   5 |   "anyOf": [
   6 |     {
   7 |       "description": "A single capability.",
   8 |       "allOf": [
   9 |         {
  10 |           "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  11 |         }
  12 |       ]
  13 |     },
  14 |     {
  15 |       "description": "A list of capabilities.",
  16 |       "type": "array",
  17 |       "items": {
  18 |         "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  19 |       }
  20 |     },
  21 |     {
  22 |       "description": "A list of capabilities.",
  23 |       "type": "object",
  24 |       "required": [
  25 |         "capabilities"
  26 |       ],
  27 |       "properties": {
  28 |         "capabilities": {
  29 |           "description": "The list of capabilities.",
  30 |           "type": "array",
  31 |           "items": {
  32 |             "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  33 |           }
  34 |         }
  35 |       }
  36 |     }
  37 |   ],
  38 |   "definitions": {
  39 |     "Capability": {
  40 |       "description": "A grouping and boundary mechanism developers can use to isolate access to the IPC layer.\n\nIt controls application windows' and webviews' fine grained access to the Tauri core, application, or plugin commands. If a webview or its window is not matching any capability then it has no access to the IPC layer at all.\n\nThis can be done to create groups of windows, based on their required system access, which can reduce impact of frontend vulnerabilities in less privileged windows. Windows can be added to a capability by exact name (e.g. `main-window`) or glob patterns like `*` or `admin-*`. A Window can have none, one, or multiple associated capabilities.\n\n## Example\n\n```json { \"identifier\": \"main-user-files-write\", \"description\": \"This capability allows the `main` window on macOS and Windows access to `filesystem` write related commands and `dialog` commands to enable programatic access to files selected by the user.\", \"windows\": [ \"main\" ], \"permissions\": [ \"core:default\", \"dialog:open\", { \"identifier\": \"fs:allow-write-text-file\", \"allow\": [{ \"path\": \"$HOME/test.txt\" }] }, ], \"platforms\": [\"macOS\",\"windows\"] } ```",
  41 |       "type": "object",
  42 |       "required": [
  43 |         "identifier",
  44 |         "permissions"
  45 |       ],
  46 |       "properties": {
  47 |         "identifier": {
  48 |           "description": "Identifier of the capability.\n\n## Example\n\n`main-user-files-write`",
  49 |           "type": "string"
  50 |         },
  51 |         "description": {
  52 |           "description": "Description of what the capability is intended to allow on associated windows.\n\nIt should contain a description of what the grouped permissions should allow.\n\n## Example\n\nThis capability allows the `main` window access to `filesystem` write related commands and `dialog` commands to enable programatic access to files selected by the user.",
  53 |           "default": "",
  54 |           "type": "string"
  55 |         },
  56 |         "remote": {
  57 |           "description": "Configure remote URLs that can use the capability permissions.\n\nThis setting is optional and defaults to not being set, as our default use case is that the content is served from our local application.\n\n:::caution Make sure you understand the security implications of providing remote sources with local system access. :::\n\n## Example\n\n```json { \"urls\": [\"https://*.mydomain.dev\"] } ```",
  58 |           "anyOf": [
  59 |             {
  60 |               "$ref": "#/definitions/CapabilityRemote"
  61 |             },
  62 |             {
  63 |               "type": "null"
  64 |             }
  65 |           ]
  66 |         },
  67 |         "local": {
  68 |           "description": "Whether this capability is enabled for local app URLs or not. Defaults to `true`.",
  69 |           "default": true,
  70 |           "type": "boolean"
  71 |         },
  72 |         "windows": {
  73 |           "description": "List of windows that are affected by this capability. Can be a glob pattern.\n\nIf a window label matches any of the patterns in this list, the capability will be enabled on all the webviews of that window, regardless of the value of [`Self::webviews`].\n\nOn multiwebview windows, prefer specifying [`Self::webviews`] and omitting [`Self::windows`] for a fine grained access control.\n\n## Example\n\n`[\"main\"]`",
  74 |           "type": "array",
  75 |           "items": {
  76 |             "type": "string"
  77 |           }
  78 |         },
  79 |         "webviews": {
  80 |           "description": "List of webviews that are affected by this capability. Can be a glob pattern.\n\nThe capability will be enabled on all the webviews whose label matches any of the patterns in this list, regardless of whether the webview's window label matches a pattern in [`Self::windows`].\n\n## Example\n\n`[\"sub-webview-one\", \"sub-webview-two\"]`",
  81 |           "type": "array",
  82 |           "items": {
  83 |             "type": "string"
  84 |           }
  85 |         },
  86 |         "permissions": {
  87 |           "description": "List of permissions attached to this capability.\n\nMust include the plugin name as prefix in the form of `${plugin-name}:${permission-name}`. For commands directly implemented in the application itself only `${permission-name}` is required.\n\n## Example\n\n```json [ \"core:default\", \"shell:allow-open\", \"dialog:open\", { \"identifier\": \"fs:allow-write-text-file\", \"allow\": [{ \"path\": \"$HOME/test.txt\" }] } ] ```",

  92 |           "uniqueItems": true

   1 | {
   2 |   "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
   3 |   "title": "CapabilityFile",
   4 |   "description": "Capability formats accepted in a capability file.",
   5 |   "anyOf": [
   6 |     {
   7 |       "description": "A single capability.",
   8 |       "allOf": [
   9 |         {
  10 |           "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  11 |         }
  12 |       ]
  13 |     },
  14 |     {
  15 |       "description": "A list of capabilities.",
  16 |       "type": "array",
  17 |       "items": {
  18 |         "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  19 |       }
  20 |     },
  21 |     {
  22 |       "description": "A list of capabilities.",
  23 |       "type": "object",
  24 |       "required": [
  25 |         "capabilities"
  26 |       ],
  27 |       "properties": {
  28 |         "capabilities": {
  29 |           "description": "The list of capabilities.",
  30 |           "type": "array",
  31 |           "items": {
  32 |             "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  33 |           }
  34 |         }
  35 |       }
  36 |     }
  37 |   ],
  38 |   "definitions": {
  39 |     "Capability": {
  40 |       "description": "A grouping and boundary mechanism developers can use to isolate access to the IPC layer.\n\nIt controls application windows' and webviews' fine grained access to the Tauri core, application, or plugin commands. If a webview or its window is not matching any capability then it has no access to the IPC layer at all.\n\nThis can be done to create groups of windows, based on their required system access, which can reduce impact of frontend vulnerabilities in less privileged windows. Windows can be added to a capability by exact name (e.g. `main-window`) or glob patterns like `*` or `admin-*`. A Window can have none, one, or multiple associated capabilities.\n\n## Example\n\n```json { \"identifier\": \"main-user-files-write\", \"description\": \"This capability allows the `main` window on macOS and Windows access to `filesystem` write related commands and `dialog` commands to enable programatic access to files selected by the user.\", \"windows\": [ \"main\" ], \"permissions\": [ \"core:default\", \"dialog:open\", { \"identifier\": \"fs:allow-write-text-file\", \"allow\": [{ \"path\": \"$HOME/test.txt\" }] }, ], \"platforms\": [\"macOS\",\"windows\"] } ```",
  41 |       "type": "object",
  42 |       "required": [
  43 |         "identifier",
  44 |         "permissions"
  45 |       ],
  46 |       "properties": {
  47 |         "identifier": {
  48 |           "description": "Identifier of the capability.\n\n## Example\n\n`main-user-files-write`",
  49 |           "type": "string"
  50 |         },
  51 |         "description": {
  52 |           "description": "Description of what the capability is intended to allow on associated windows.\n\nIt should contain a description of what the grouped permissions should allow.\n\n## Example\n\nThis capability allows the `main` window access to `filesystem` write related commands and `dialog` commands to enable programatic access to files selected by the user.",
  53 |           "default": "",
  54 |           "type": "string"
  55 |         },
  56 |         "remote": {
  57 |           "description": "Configure remote URLs that can use the capability permissions.\n\nThis setting is optional and defaults to not being set, as our default use case is that the content is served from our local application.\n\n:::caution Make sure you understand the security implications of providing remote sources with local system access. :::\n\n## Example\n\n```json { \"urls\": [\"https://*.mydomain.dev\"] } ```",
  58 |           "anyOf": [
  59 |             {
  60 |               "$ref": "#/definitions/CapabilityRemote"

  65 |           ]
  66 |         },
  67 |         "local": {

  70 |           "type": "boolean"
  71 |         },
  72 |         "windows": {
  73 |           "description": "List of windows that are affected by this capability.   74 |           "type": "array",

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/examples/tauri-app/src-tauri/gen/schemas/windows-schema.json:

   1 | {
   2 |   "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
   3 |   "title": "CapabilityFile",
   4 |   "description": "Capability formats accepted in a capability file.",
   5 |   "anyOf": [
   6 |     {
   7 |       "description": "A single capability.",
   8 |       "allOf": [
   9 |         {
  10 |           "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  11 |         }
  12 |       ]
  13 |     },
  14 |     {
  15 |       "description": "A list of capabilities.",
  16 |       "type": "array",
  17 |       "items": {
  18 |         "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  19 |       }
  20 |     },
  21 |     {
  22 |       "description": "A list of capabilities.",
  23 |       "type": "object",
  24 |       "required": [
  25 |         "capabilities"
  26 |       ],
  27 |       "properties": {
  28 |         "capabilities": {
  29 |           "description": "The list of capabilities.",
  30 |           "type": "array",
  31 |           "items": {
  32 |             "$ref": "#/definitions/Capability"
  33 |           }
  34 |         }
  35 |       }
  36 |     }
  37 |   ],
  38 |   "definitions": {
  39 |     "Capability": {
  40 |       "description": "A grouping and boundary mechanism developers can use to isolate access to the IPC layer.\n\nIt controls application windows' and webviews' fine grained access to the Tauri core, application, or plugin commands. If a webview or its window is not matching any capability then it has no access to the IPC layer at all.\n\nThis can be done to create groups of windows, based on their required system access, which can reduce impact of frontend vulnerabilities in less privileged windows. Windows can be added to a capability by exact name (e.g. `main-window`) or glob patterns like `*` or `admin-*`. A Window can have none, one, or multiple associated capabilities.\n\n## Example\n\n```json { \"identifier\": \"main-user-files-write\", \"description\": \"This capability allows the `main` window on macOS and Windows access to `filesystem` write related commands and `dialog` commands to enable programatic access to files selected by the user.\", \"windows\": [ \"main\" ], \"permissions\": [ \"core:default\", \"dialog:open\", { \"identifier\": \"fs:allow-write-text-file\", \"allow\": [{ \"path\": \"$HOME/test.txt\" }] }, ], \"platforms\": [\"macOS\",\"windows\"] } ```",
  41 |       "type": "object",
  42 |       "required": [
  43 |         "identifier",
  44 |         "permissions"
  45 |       ],
  46 |       "properties": {
  47 |         "identifier": {
  48 |           "description": "Identifier of the capability.\n\n## Example\n\n`main-user-files-write`",
  49 |           "type": "string"
  50 |         },
  51 |         "description": {
  52 |           "description": "Description of what the capability is intended to allow on associated windows.\n\nIt should contain a description of what the grouped permissions should allow.\n\n## Example\n\nThis capability allows the `main` window access to `filesystem` write related commands and `dialog` commands to enable programatic access to files selected by the user.",
  53 |           "default": "",
  54 |           "type": "string"
  55 |         },
  56 |         "remote": {
  57 |           "description": "Configure remote URLs that can use the capability permissions.\n\nThis setting is optional and defaults to not being set, as our default use case is that the content is served from our local application.\n\n:::caution Make sure you understand the security implications of providing remote sources with local system access. :::\n\n## Example\n\n```json { \"urls\": [\"https://*.mydomain.dev\"] } ```",
  58 |           "anyOf": [
  59 |             {
  60 |               "$ref": "#/definitions/CapabilityRemote"
  61 |             },
  62 |             {
  63 |               "type": "null"
  64 |             }
  65 |           ]
  66 |         },
  67 |         "local": {
  68 |           "description": "Whether this capability is enabled for local app URLs or not. Defaults to `true`.",
  69 |           "default": true,
  70 |           "type": "boolean"
  71 |         },
  72 |         "windows": {
  73 |           "description": "List of windows that are affected by this capability. Can be a glob pattern.\n\nIf a window label matches any of the patterns in this list, the capability will be enabled on all the webviews of that window, regardless of the value of [`Self::webviews`].\n\nOn multiwebview windows, prefer specifying [`Self::webviews`] and omitting [`Self::windows`] for a fine grained access control.\n\n## Example\n\n`[\"main\"]`",
  74 |           "type": "array",
  75 |           "items": {
  76 |             "type": "string"
  77 |           }
  78 |         },

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Taiizor/tauri-plugin-cache/bea49f7492b70bcd974d5bbbc670e8502e8e30fc/examples/tauri-app/src-tauri/icons/icon.png


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/examples/tauri-app/src-tauri/src/lib.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // Learn more about Tauri commands at https://v2.tauri.app/develop/calling-rust/#commands
 2 | #[tauri::command]
 3 | fn greet(name: &str) -> String {
 4 |     format!("Hello, {}! You've been greeted from Rust!", name)
 5 | }
 6 | 
 7 | #[cfg_attr(mobile, tauri::mobile_entry_point)]
 8 | pub fn run() {
 9 |     let cache_config = tauri_plugin_cache::CacheConfig {
10 |         cache_dir: Some("my_app_cache".into()),
11 |         cache_file_name: Some("cache_data.json".into()),
12 |         cleanup_interval: Some(120),
13 |         default_compression: Some(true),
14 |         compression_level: Some(9),
15 |         compression_threshold: Some(4096),
16 |         compression_method: Some(tauri_plugin_cache::CompressionMethod::Lzma2),
17 |     };
18 |     
19 |     tauri::Builder::default()
20 |         .invoke_handler(tauri::generate_handler![greet])
21 |         //.plugin(tauri_plugin_cache::init())
22 |         .plugin(tauri_plugin_cache::init_with_config(cache_config))
23 |         .run(tauri::generate_context!())
24 |         .expect("error while running tauri application");
25 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/examples/tauri-app/src-tauri/src/main.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1 | // Prevents additional console window on Windows in release, DO NOT REMOVE!!
2 | #![cfg_attr(not(debug_assertions), windows_subsystem = "windows")]
3 | 
4 | fn main() {
5 |   tauri_app_lib::run();
6 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/examples/tauri-app/src-tauri/tauri.conf.json:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | {
 2 |   "productName": "tauri-app",
 3 |   "version": "0.1.0",
 4 |   "identifier": "com.taiizor.cache",
 5 |   "build": {
 6 |     "beforeDevCommand": "pnpm dev",
 7 |     "beforeBuildCommand": "pnpm build",
 8 |     "devUrl": "http://localhost:1420",
 9 |     "frontendDist": "../dist"
10 |   },
11 |   "app": {
12 |     "withGlobalTauri": false,
13 |     "security": {
14 |       "csp": null
15 |     },
16 |     "windows": [
17 |       {
18 |         "fullscreen": false,
19 |         "height": 600,
20 |         "resizable": true,
21 |         "title": "Tauri Plugin Cache",
22 |         "width": 800,
23 |         "center": true
24 |       }
25 |     ]
26 |   },
27 |   "bundle": {
28 |     "active": true,
29 |     "targets": "all",
30 |     "icon": [
31 |       "icons/32x32.png",
32 |       "icons/128x128.png",
33 |       "icons/128x128@2x.png",
34 |       "icons/icon.icns",
35 |       "icons/icon.ico"
36 |     ]
37 |   }
38 | }

 2 |   import Greet from './lib/Greet.svelte'

 5 | </script>

11 |     <a href="https://vite.dev" target="_blank">
12 |       <img src="/vite.svg" class="logo vite" alt="Vite Logo" />

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/examples/tauri-app/src/lib/CacheControls.svelte:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | <script>
  2 |   import { set, get, has, remove, clear, stats, CompressionMethod } from 'tauri-plugin-cache-api'
  3 | 
  4 | 	let response = ''
  5 | 	let key = 'test-key'
  6 | 	let value = 'test-value'
  7 | 	let ttl = '10'
  8 | 	let compress = false
  9 | 	let compressionMethod = CompressionMethod.Zlib
 10 | 
 11 | 	function updateResponse(returnValue) {
 12 | 		response = `[${new Date().toLocaleTimeString()}] ` + (typeof returnValue === 'string' ? returnValue : JSON.stringify(returnValue)) + '<br>' + response
 13 | 	}
 14 | 
 15 | 	function setItem() {
 16 | 		const ttlValue = ttl !== '' ? parseInt(ttl) : undefined;
 17 | 		
 18 | 		set(key, value, { 
 19 | 			ttl: ttlValue,
 20 | 			compress: compress,
 21 | 			compressionMethod: compress ? compressionMethod : undefined
 22 | 		})
 23 | 			.then(() => {
 24 | 				const methodInfo = compress ? ` (${compressionMethod} compressed)` : '';
 25 | 				updateResponse(`Successfully set "${key}" with value: ${value}${methodInfo}`);
 26 |       })
 27 | 			.catch(err => updateResponse(`Error: ${err.toString()}`))
 28 | 	}
 29 | 
 30 | 	// Function to generate large data - to demonstrate the effect of compression
 31 | 	function generateLargeData() {
 32 | 		// Create an array with 1000 elements
 33 | 		const largeArray = Array.from({ length: 1000 }, (_, i) => ({
 34 | 			id: i,
 35 | 			name: `Item ${i}`,
 36 | 			description: `This is a test description for item ${i} that has some repetitive text to demonstrate compression efficiency. Compression works best with repetitive content.`
 37 | 		}));
 38 | 		
 39 | 		value = JSON.stringify(largeArray);
 40 | 		updateResponse(`Generated large data (${(value.length / 1024).toFixed(2)} KB)`);
 41 | 	}
 42 | 
 43 | 	function getItem() {
 44 | 		get(key)
 45 | 			.then(result => updateResponse(`Get "${key}": ${JSON.stringify(result)}`))
 46 | 			.catch(err => updateResponse(`Error: ${err.toString()}`))
 47 | 	}
 48 | 
 49 | 	function hasItem() {
 50 | 		has(key)
 51 | 			.then(exists => updateResponse(`Has "${key}": ${exists}`))
 52 | 			.catch(err => updateResponse(`Error: ${err.toString()}`))
 53 | 	}
 54 | 
 55 | 	function removeItem() {
 56 | 		remove(key)
 57 | 			.then(() => updateResponse(`Removed "${key}"`))
 58 | 			.catch(err => updateResponse(`Error: ${err.toString()}`))
 59 | 	}
 60 | 
 61 | 	function clearCache() {
 62 | 		clear()
 63 | 			.then(() => updateResponse('Cache cleared'))
 64 | 			.catch(err => updateResponse(`Error: ${err.toString()}`))
 65 | 	}
 66 | 	
 67 | 	function getStats() {
 68 | 		stats()
 69 | 			.then(result => updateResponse(`Cache stats: Total items: ${result.totalSize}, Active items: ${result.activeSize}`))
 70 | 			.catch(err => updateResponse(`Error: ${err.toString()}`))
 71 | 	}
 72 | </script>
 73 | 
 74 | <div class="cache-controls">
 75 |   <h2>Cache Controls</h2>
 76 |   
 77 |   <div class="input-group">
 78 |     <label for="key">Key:</label>
 79 |     <input id="key" bind:value={key} />
 80 |   </div>
 81 |   
 82 |   <div class="input-group">
 83 |     <label for="value">Value:</label>
 84 |     <textarea id="value" bind:value={value} rows="4"></textarea>
 85 |     <button class="generate-btn" on:click={generateLargeData}>Generate Test Data</button>
 86 |   </div>
 87 |   
 88 |   <div class="input-group">
 89 |     <label for="ttl">TTL (seconds):</label>
 90 |     <input id="ttl" bind:value={ttl} type="number" min="0" />
 91 |   </div>
 92 |   
 93 |   <div class="input-group toggle-group">
 94 |     <div class="toggle-label-container">
 95 |       <label for="compress">Compress data:</label>
 96 |       <div class="toggle-wrapper">
 97 |         <input id="compress" type="checkbox" class="toggle-input" bind:checked={compress} />
 98 |         <label for="compress" class="toggle-label"></label>
 99 |       </div>
100 |     </div>
101 |     <div class="tooltip">Compression is recommended for large text data to save disk space</div>
102 |   </div>
103 |   
104 |   {#if compress}
105 |   <div class="input-group radio-group">
106 |     <label>Compression Method:</label>
107 |     <div class="radio-options">
108 |       <label class="radio-label">
109 |         <input type="radio" bind:group={compressionMethod} value={CompressionMethod.Zlib} id="zlib-radio" class="custom-radio" />
110 |         <span class="radio-custom"></span>
111 |         <span>Zlib (Fast)</span>
112 |       </label>
113 |       <label class="radio-label">
114 |         <input type="radio" bind:group={compressionMethod} value={CompressionMethod.Lzma2} id="lzma2-radio" class="custom-radio" />
115 |         <span class="radio-custom"></span>
116 |         <span>LZMA2 (High Ratio)</span>
117 |       </label>
118 |     </div>
119 |   </div>
120 |   <div class="tooltip compression-tooltip">LZMA2 provides better compression but is slower. Zlib is faster but offers less compression.</div>
121 |   {/if}
122 |   
123 |   <div class="button-group">
124 |     <button on:click={setItem}>Set</button>
125 |     <button on:click={getItem}>Get</button>
126 |     <button on:click={hasItem}>Has</button>
127 |     <button on:click={removeItem}>Remove</button>
128 |     <button on:click={clearCache}>Clear All</button>
129 |     <button on:click={getStats}>Stats</button>
130 |   </div>
131 |   
132 |   {#if response}
133 |     <div class="response">
134 |         <h3>Response:</h3>
135 |         <div class="response-content">{@html response}</div>
136 |     </div>
137 |   {/if}
138 | </div>
139 |
