--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/examples/tauri-app/src/lib/CompressTest.svelte:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | <script>
  2 |   import { set, get, stats, CompressionMethod } from 'tauri-plugin-cache-api';
  3 |   
  4 |   let testResults = "";
  5 |   let isRunning = false;
  6 |   
  7 |   async function runCompressionTest() {
  8 |     if (isRunning) return;
  9 |     
 10 |     isRunning = true;
 11 |     testResults = "Starting compression method comparison test...\n";
 12 |     
 13 |     // Warning for mobile devices
 14 |     if (navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase().includes('android') || 
 15 |         navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase().includes('iphone')) {
 16 |       testResults += `⚠️ WARNING: Test data size is automatically limited on mobile devices.\n`;
 17 |       testResults += `LZMA2 compression is memory intensive on mobile devices, so performance may vary.\n\n`;
 18 |     }
 19 |     
 20 |     try {
 21 |       // Create large data for testing
 22 |       const largeData = generateLargeData();
 23 |       const dataSize = new TextEncoder().encode(JSON.stringify(largeData)).length;
 24 |       testResults += `Test data size: ${formatSize(dataSize)}\n\n`;
 25 |       
 26 |       // First save without compression
 27 |       const uncompressedKey = "test-uncompressed";
 28 |       const startUncompressed = performance.now();
 29 |       await set(uncompressedKey, largeData, { compress: false });
 30 |       const endUncompressed = performance.now();
 31 |       testResults += `Uncompressed save time: ${(endUncompressed - startUncompressed).toFixed(2)} ms\n`;
 32 |       
 33 |       // Test with Zlib compression
 34 |       const zlibKey = "test-zlib";
 35 |       const startZlib = performance.now();
 36 |       await set(zlibKey, largeData, { 
 37 |         compress: true,
 38 |         compressionMethod: CompressionMethod.Zlib 
 39 |       });
 40 |       const endZlib = performance.now();
 41 |       testResults += `Zlib compression save time: ${(endZlib - startZlib).toFixed(2)} ms\n`;
 42 |       
 43 |       // Test with LZMA2 compression
 44 |       const lzma2Key = "test-lzma2";
 45 |       const startLzma2 = performance.now();
 46 |       await set(lzma2Key, largeData, { 
 47 |         compress: true,
 48 |         compressionMethod: CompressionMethod.Lzma2 
 49 |       });
 50 |       const endLzma2 = performance.now();
 51 |       testResults += `LZMA2 compression save time: ${(endLzma2 - startLzma2).toFixed(2)} ms\n\n`;
 52 |       
 53 |       // Get cache statistics
 54 |       const cacheStats = await stats();
 55 |       testResults += `Total items in cache: ${cacheStats.totalSize}\n\n`;
 56 |       
 57 |       // Read performance tests
 58 |       testResults += `--- Reading Performance ---\n`;
 59 |       
 60 |       // Read uncompressed
 61 |       const startReadUncompressed = performance.now();
 62 |       await get(uncompressedKey);
 63 |       const endReadUncompressed = performance.now();
 64 |       testResults += `Uncompressed read time: ${(endReadUncompressed - startReadUncompressed).toFixed(2)} ms\n`;
 65 |       
 66 |       // Read Zlib compressed
 67 |       const startReadZlib = performance.now();
 68 |       await get(zlibKey);
 69 |       const endReadZlib = performance.now();
 70 |       testResults += `Zlib compressed read time: ${(endReadZlib - startReadZlib).toFixed(2)} ms\n`;
 71 |       
 72 |       // Read LZMA2 compressed
 73 |       const startReadLzma2 = performance.now();
 74 |       await get(lzma2Key);
 75 |       const endReadLzma2 = performance.now();
 76 |       testResults += `LZMA2 compressed read time: ${(endReadLzma2 - startReadLzma2).toFixed(2)} ms\n\n`;
 77 |       
 78 |       testResults += `--- Compression Efficiency Comparison ---\n`;
 79 |       testResults += `Data Type: JSON with repetitive content\n`;
 80 |       testResults += `Zlib: Fast compression/decompression, good for general use\n`;
 81 |       testResults += `LZMA2: Better compression ratio, slower, best for text and base64 data\n`;
 82 |       
 83 |       testResults += "\nTest completed! For optimal performance, choose Zlib for frequently changing data and LZMA2 for maximum space savings of rarely changed data.";
 84 |       
 85 |     } catch (error) {
 86 |       testResults += `Error: ${error.message}`;
 87 |     }
 88 |     
 89 |     isRunning = false;
 90 |   }
 91 |   
 92 |   // Create test data with 1000 elements
 93 |   function generateLargeData() {
 94 |     // Use fewer elements for mobile devices
 95 |     const isMobile = navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase().includes('android') || 
 96 |                     navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase().includes('iphone');
 97 |     const elementCount = isMobile ? 300 : 1000; // 300 elements for mobile, 1000 for desktop
 98 |     
 99 |     // Limit description length
100 |     const descLength = isMobile ? 100 : 300; // Shorter description for mobile
101 |     
102 |     return Array.from({ length: elementCount }, (_, i) => ({
103 |       id: i,
104 |       name: `Item ${i}`,
105 |       description: `This is a test description for item ${i} to demonstrate compression efficiency.`.substring(0, descLength),
106 |       metadata: {
107 |         timestamp: Date.now(),
108 |         tags: ["test", "compression", "example", "tauri", "cache", "plugin"],
109 |         isActive: i % 2 === 0,
110 |         priority: Math.floor(Math.random() * 100)
111 |       }
112 |     }));
113 |   }
114 |   
115 |   function formatSize(bytes) {
116 |     if (bytes < 1024) return `${bytes} bytes`;
117 |     else if (bytes < 1024 * 1024) return `${(bytes / 1024).toFixed(2)} KB`;
118 |     else return `${(bytes / (1024 * 1024)).toFixed(2)} MB`;
119 |   }
120 |   
121 |   // Test a specific compression method
122 |   async function testSpecificMethod(method) {
123 |     if (isRunning) return;
124 |     
125 |     isRunning = true;
126 |     testResults = `Starting ${method} compression test...\n`;
127 |     
128 |     // Warning for LZMA2 on mobile devices
129 |     if (method === 'lzma2' && (navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase().includes('android') || 
130 |                              navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase().includes('iphone'))) {
131 |       testResults += `⚠️ WARNING: LZMA2 compression may cause issues on mobile devices due to memory limitations.\n`;
132 |       testResults += `Memory exhaustion errors may occur with large data.\n\n`;
133 |     }
134 |     
135 |     try {
136 |       // Create large data for testing
137 |       const largeData = generateLargeData();
138 |       const dataSize = new TextEncoder().encode(JSON.stringify(largeData)).length;
139 |       testResults += `Test data size: ${formatSize(dataSize)}\n\n`;
140 |       
141 |       // Get correct compression method
142 |       const compressionMethod = method === 'zlib' 
143 |         ? CompressionMethod.Zlib 
144 |         : CompressionMethod.Lzma2;
145 |       
146 |       // Save with specified compression
147 |       const compressedKey = `test-${method}`;
148 |       const startCompressed = performance.now();
149 |       await set(compressedKey, largeData, { 
150 |         compress: true,
151 |         compressionMethod: compressionMethod
152 |       });
153 |       const endCompressed = performance.now();
154 |       testResults += `${method.toUpperCase()} compression time: ${(endCompressed - startCompressed).toFixed(2)} ms\n`;
155 |       
156 |       // Read performance
157 |       const startReadCompressed = performance.now();
158 |       await get(compressedKey);
159 |       const endReadCompressed = performance.now();
160 |       testResults += `${method.toUpperCase()} read time: ${(endReadCompressed - startReadCompressed).toFixed(2)} ms\n`;
161 |       
162 |       testResults += `\nTest completed for ${method.toUpperCase()} compression.`;
163 |       
164 |     } catch (error) {
165 |       testResults += `Error: ${error.message}`;
166 |     }
167 |     
168 |     isRunning = false;
169 |   }
170 | </script>
171 | 
172 | <div class="compression-test">
173 |   <h2>Compression Test</h2>
174 |   <p>This test measures the effect of compression on performance and size.</p>
175 |   
176 |   <div class="test-buttons">
177 |     <button on:click={runCompressionTest} disabled={isRunning} class="main-btn">
178 |       {isRunning ? 'Test running...' : 'Run Comprehensive Test'}
179 |     </button>
180 |     
181 |     <div class="specific-test-buttons">
182 |       <button on:click={() => testSpecificMethod('zlib')} disabled={isRunning} class="method-btn zlib-btn">
183 |         <span class="method-name">Zlib</span>
184 |         <span class="method-desc">Test Fast Compression</span>
185 |       </button>
186 |       
187 |       <button on:click={() => testSpecificMethod('lzma2')} disabled={isRunning} class="method-btn lzma-btn">
188 |         <span class="method-name">LZMA2</span>
189 |         <span class="method-desc">Test High Ratio Compression</span>
190 |       </button>
191 |     </div>
192 |   </div>
193 |   
194 |   {#if testResults}
195 |     <div class="test-results">
196 |       <h3>Test Results:</h3>
197 |       <pre>{testResults}</pre>
198 |     </div>
199 |   {/if}
200 | </div>
201 | 
202 | <style>
203 |   /* Theme variables use CSS custom properties for theme support */
204 |   :root {
205 |     --test-border-color: var(--border-color, #ddd);
206 |     --test-background: var(--background, white);
207 |     --button-bg: var(--primary-color, #2c2c54);
208 |     --button-hover-bg: var(--primary-hover, #474787);

/examples/tauri-app/src/lib/Greet.svelte:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | <script>
 2 |   import { invoke } from "@tauri-apps/api/core"
 3 | 
 4 |   let name = "";
 5 |   let greetMsg = ""
 6 | 
 7 |   async function greet(){
 8 |     // Learn more about Tauri commands at https://v2.tauri.app/develop/calling-rust/#commands
 9 |     greetMsg = await invoke("greet", { name })
10 |   }
11 | </script>
12 | 
13 | <div>
14 |   <div class="row">
15 |     <input id="greet-input" placeholder="Enter a name..." bind:value={name} />
16 |     <button on:click={greet}>
17 |       Greet
18 |     </button>
19 |   </div>
20 |   <p>{greetMsg}</p>
21 | </div>

/examples/tauri-app/vite.config.js:

 1 | import { defineConfig } from "vite";
 2 | import { svelte } from "@sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte";
 3 | 
 4 | const host = process.env.TAURI_DEV_HOST;
 5 | 
 6 | // https://vite.dev/config/
 7 | export default defineConfig({
 8 |   plugins: [svelte()],
 9 | 
10 |   // Vite options tailored for Tauri development and only applied in `tauri dev` or `tauri build`
11 |   // prevent Vite from obscuring rust errors
12 |   clearScreen: false,
13 |   // tauri expects a fixed port, fail if that port is not available
14 |   server: {
15 |     host: host || false,
16 |     port: 1420,
17 |     strictPort: true,
18 |     hmr: host ? {
19 |       protocol: 'ws',
20 |       host,
21 |       port: 1421
22 |     } : undefined,
23 |   },
24 | })


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/guest-js/index.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | import { invoke } from '@tauri-apps/api/core'
  2 | 
  3 | /**
  4 |  * Supported compression methods
  5 |  */
  6 | export enum CompressionMethod {
  7 |   /**
  8 |    * Zlib compression (default, balanced speed/ratio)
  9 |    */
 10 |   Zlib = 'zlib',
 11 |   /**
 12 |    * LZMA2 compression (better compression ratio, slower)
 13 |    */
 14 |   Lzma2 = 'lzma2'
 15 | }
 16 | 
 17 | /**
 18 |  * Interface for cache statistics
 19 |  */
 20 | export interface CacheStats {
 21 |   /**
 22 |    * Total number of items in the cache
 23 |    */
 24 |   totalSize: number;
 25 |   /**
 26 |    * Number of active (non-expired) items in the cache
 27 |    */
 28 |   activeSize: number;
 29 | }
 30 | 
 31 | /**
 32 |  * Options for setting a cache item
 33 |  */
 34 | export interface SetItemOptions {
 35 |   /**
 36 |    * Time-to-live in seconds. If not provided, the item will never expire.
 37 |    */
 38 |   ttl?: number;
 39 |   /**
 40 |    * Whether to compress the data before storing. If not provided, uses the default compression setting.
 41 |    */
 42 |   compress?: boolean;
 43 |   /**
 44 |    * Compression method to use. If not provided, uses the default compression method.
 45 |    */
 46 |   compressionMethod?: CompressionMethod;
 47 | }
 48 | 
 49 | /**
 50 |  * Sets an item in the cache with optional TTL and compression
 51 |  * @param key The key to store the value under
 52 |  * @param value The value to store
 53 |  * @param options Options for setting the cache item
 54 |  * @returns A promise that resolves when the operation is complete
 55 |  * @example
 56 |  * ```typescript
 57 |  * // Set an item with no expiration
 58 |  * await cache.set('user', { name: 'John', age: 30 });
 59 |  * 
 60 |  * // Set an item that expires in 60 seconds
 61 |  * await cache.set('token', 'abc123', { ttl: 60 });
 62 |  * 
 63 |  * // Set an item with compression enabled
 64 |  * await cache.set('largeData', largeObject, { compress: true });
 65 |  * 
 66 |  * // Set an item with both TTL and compression
 67 |  * await cache.set('temporaryData', data, { ttl: 300, compress: true });
 68 |  * 
 69 |  * // Set an item with LZMA2 compression for better compression ratio
 70 |  * await cache.set('largeTextData', largeText, { compress: true, compressionMethod: CompressionMethod.Lzma2 });
 71 |  * 
 72 |  * // Set an item with Zlib compression for faster compression
 73 |  * await cache.set('mediumData', mediumObject, { compress: true, compressionMethod: CompressionMethod.Zlib });
 74 |  * ```
 75 |  */
 76 | export async function set(key: string, value: any, options?: SetItemOptions): Promise<void> {
 77 |   await invoke('plugin:cache|set', {
 78 |     key,
 79 |     value,
 80 |     options,
 81 |   });
 82 | }
 83 | 
 84 | /**
 85 |  * Gets an item from the cache
 86 |  * @param key The key to retrieve
 87 |  * @returns The stored value or null if not found or expired
 88 |  * @example
 89 |  * ```typescript
 90 |  * const user = await cache.get<User>('user');
 91 |  * if (user) {
 92 |  *   console.log(user.name); // 'John'
 93 |  * }
 94 |  * ```
 95 |  */
 96 | export async function get<T = any>(key: string): Promise<T | null> {
 97 |   const result = await invoke<T | null>('plugin:cache|get', {
 98 |     key,
 99 |   });
100 |   return result === undefined ? null : result;
101 | }
102 | 
103 | /**
104 |  * Checks if an item exists in the cache and is not expired
105 |  * @param key The key to check
106 |  * @returns True if the item exists and is not expired
107 |  * @example
108 |  * ```typescript
109 |  * if (await cache.has('user')) {
110 |  *   // User exists in cache
111 |  * }
112 |  * ```
113 |  */
114 | export async function has(key: string): Promise<boolean> {
115 |   const response = await invoke<{ value: boolean }>('plugin:cache|has', {
116 |     key,
117 |   });
118 |   return response.value;
119 | }
120 | 
121 | /**
122 |  * Removes an item from the cache
123 |  * @param key The key to remove
124 |  * @returns A promise that resolves when the operation is complete
125 |  * @example
126 |  * ```typescript
127 |  * await cache.remove('user');
128 |  * ```
129 |  */
130 | export async function remove(key: string): Promise<void> {
131 |   await invoke('plugin:cache|remove', {
132 |     key,
133 |   });
134 | }
135 | 
136 | /**
137 |  * Clears all items from the cache
138 |  * @returns A promise that resolves when the operation is complete
139 |  * @example
140 |  * ```typescript
141 |  * await cache.clear();
142 |  * ```
143 |  */
144 | export async function clear(): Promise<void> {
145 |   await invoke('plugin:cache|clear');
146 | }
147 | 
148 | /**
149 |  * Gets statistics about the cache
150 |  * @returns Cache statistics including the number of active and total items
151 |  * @example
152 |  * ```typescript
153 |  * const stats = await cache.stats();
154 |  * console.log(`Cache has ${stats.totalSize} items (${stats.activeSize} active)`);
155 |  * ```
156 |  */
157 | export async function stats(): Promise<CacheStats> {
158 |   return await invoke<CacheStats>('plugin:cache|stats');
159 | }

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/ios/Package.swift:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // swift-tools-version:5.3
 2 | // The swift-tools-version declares the minimum version of Swift required to build this package.
 3 | 
 4 | import PackageDescription
 5 | 
 6 | let package = Package(
 7 |     name: "tauri-plugin-cache",
 8 |     platforms: [
 9 |         .macOS(.v10_13),
10 |         .iOS(.v13),
11 |     ],
12 |     products: [
13 |         // Products define the executables and libraries a package produces, and make them visible to other packages.
14 |         .library(
15 |             name: "tauri-plugin-cache",
16 |             type: .static,
17 |             targets: ["tauri-plugin-cache"]),
18 |     ],
19 |     dependencies: [
20 |         .package(name: "Tauri", path: "../.tauri/tauri-api"),
21 |         .package(url: "https://github.com/OlehKulykov/PLzmaSDK.git", .exact("1.5.0"))
22 |     ],
23 |     targets: [
24 |         // Targets are the basic building blocks of a package. A target can define a module or a test suite.
25 |         // Targets can depend on other targets in this package, and on products in packages this package depends on.
26 |         .target(
27 |             name: "tauri-plugin-cache",
28 |             dependencies: [
29 |                 .byName(name: "Tauri"),
30 |                 .product(name: "PLzmaSDK", package: "PLzmaSDK")
31 |             ],
32 |             path: "Sources")
33 |     ]
34 | )


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/ios/Sources/CachePlugin.swift:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | import SwiftRs
  2 | import Tauri
  3 | import UIKit
  4 | import Foundation
  5 | import Compression
  6 | import PLzmaSDK
  7 | 
  8 | // MARK: - Structures and Models
  9 | 
 10 | class ConfigureRequest: Decodable {
 11 |     let default_compression: Bool?
 12 |     let compression_level: Int?
 13 |     let compression_threshold: Int?
 14 |     let compression_method: String?
 15 | }
 16 | 
 17 | class CompressionConfig: Decodable {
 18 |     let enabled: Bool
 19 |     let level: Int
 20 |     let threshold: Int
 21 |     let method: String
 22 | }
 23 | 
 24 | class SetRequest<T: Decodable>: Decodable {
 25 |     let key: String
 26 |     let value: T
 27 |     let options: SetItemOptions?
 28 | }
 29 | 
 30 | class SetItemOptions: Decodable {
 31 |     let ttl: TimeInterval?
 32 |     let compress: Bool?
 33 |     let compressionMethod: String?
 34 | }
 35 | 
 36 | class GetRequest: Decodable {
 37 |     let key: String
 38 | }
 39 | 
 40 | class HasRequest: Decodable {
 41 |     let key: String
 42 | }
 43 | 
 44 | class RemoveRequest: Decodable {
 45 |     let key: String
 46 | }
 47 | 
 48 | class EmptyResponse: Encodable {
 49 | }
 50 | 
 51 | class BooleanResponse: Encodable {
 52 |     let value: Bool
 53 |     
 54 |     init(value: Bool) {
 55 |         self.value = value
 56 |     }
 57 | }
 58 | 
 59 | class CacheStats: Encodable {
 60 |     let totalSize: Int
 61 |     let activeSize: Int
 62 |     
 63 |     init(totalSize: Int, activeSize: Int) {
 64 |         self.totalSize = totalSize
 65 |         self.activeSize = activeSize
 66 |     }
 67 | }
 68 | 
 69 | // MARK: - Cache Plugin
 70 | 
 71 | class CachePlugin: Plugin {
 72 |     private let cacheDirectory: URL
 73 |     private var defaultCompression = true
 74 |     private var compressionLevel = 6
 75 |     private var compressionThreshold = 1024 // 1KB
 76 |     private var compressionMethod = "zlib"
 77 |     
 78 |     private let fileManager = FileManager.default
 79 |     private let syncQueue = DispatchQueue(label: "app.tauri.plugin.cache.sync")
 80 |     
 81 |     override init() {
 82 |         // Create cache directory
 83 |         let appCacheDir = fileManager.urls(for: .cachesDirectory, in: .userDomainMask).first!
 84 |         cacheDirectory = appCacheDir.appendingPathComponent("tauri_cache", isDirectory: true)
 85 |         
 86 |         super.init()
 87 |         
 88 |         // Create directory if it doesn't exist
 89 |         if !fileManager.fileExists(atPath: cacheDirectory.path) {
 90 |             try? fileManager.createDirectory(at: cacheDirectory, withIntermediateDirectories: true)
 91 |         }
 92 |         
 93 |         print("Cache plugin initialized at \(cacheDirectory.path)")
 94 |     }
 95 |     
 96 |     // MARK: - API Methods
 97 |     
 98 |     @objc public func configure(_ invoke: Invoke) throws {
 99 |         let args = try invoke.parseArgs(ConfigureRequest.self)
100 |         
101 |         if let defaultCompression = args.default_compression {
102 |             self.defaultCompression = defaultCompression
103 |         }
104 |         
105 |         if let compressionLevel = args.compression_level {
106 |             self.compressionLevel = compressionLevel
107 |         }
108 |         
109 |         if let compressionThreshold = args.compression_threshold {
110 |             self.compressionThreshold = compressionThreshold
111 |         }
112 |         
113 |         if let compressionMethod = args.compression_method {
114 |             self.compressionMethod = compressionMethod
115 |         }
116 |         
117 |         print("Configure: compression=\(defaultCompression), level=\(compressionLevel), method=\(compressionMethod)")
118 |         invoke.resolve()
119 |     }
120 |     
121 |     @objc public func updateCompressionConfig(_ invoke: Invoke) throws {
122 |         let config = try invoke.parseArgs(CompressionConfig.self)
123 |         self.defaultCompression = config.enabled
124 |         self.compressionLevel = config.level
125 |         self.compressionThreshold = config.threshold
126 |         self.compressionMethod = config.method
127 |         
128 |         print("Updated compression config: enabled=\(defaultCompression), level=\(compressionLevel), method=\(compressionMethod)")
129 |         invoke.resolve()
130 |     }
131 |     
132 |     @objc public func set(_ invoke: Invoke) throws {
133 |         // A slightly different approach to decode generic types in Swift
134 |         let json = invoke.argsJson
135 |         guard let jsonData = json.data(using: .utf8) else {
136 |             throw PluginError(code: .invalidArgs, message: "Invalid JSON data")
137 |         }
138 |         
139 |         guard let dict = try JSONSerialization.jsonObject(with: jsonData) as? [String: Any],
140 |               let key = dict["key"] as? String,
141 |               dict["value"] != nil else {
142 |             throw PluginError(code: .invalidArgs, message: "Missing key or value")
143 |         }
144 |         
145 |         // Extract options separately
146 |         var ttl: TimeInterval? = nil
147 |         var shouldCompress = self.defaultCompression
148 |         var compressionMethodToUse = self.compressionMethod
149 |         
150 |         if let options = dict["options"] as? [String: Any] {
151 |             ttl = options["ttl"] as? TimeInterval
152 |             if let compress = options["compress"] as? Bool {
153 |                 shouldCompress = compress
154 |             }
155 |             if let method = options["compressionMethod"] as? String {
156 |                 compressionMethodToUse = method
157 |             }
158 |         }
159 |         
160 |         // Store as JSON data
161 |         let valueData: Data
162 |         if let value = dict["value"] {
163 |             valueData = try JSONSerialization.data(withJSONObject: value)
164 |         } else {
165 |             valueData = "null".data(using: .utf8)!
166 |         }
167 |         
168 |         // Apply compression
169 |         let finalData: Data
170 |         var isCompressed = false
171 |         
172 |         if shouldCompress && valueData.count > compressionThreshold {
173 |             // Choose compression method
174 |             if compressionMethodToUse.lowercased() == "lzma2" {
175 |                 finalData = compressWithLZMA2(data: valueData)
176 |                 isCompressed = true
177 |             } else {
178 |                 finalData = compressWithZlib(data: valueData)
179 |                 isCompressed = true
180 |             }
181 |         } else {
182 |             finalData = valueData
183 |         }
184 |         
185 |         // Create cache entry
186 |         var cacheEntry: [String: Any] = [
187 |             "value": finalData.base64EncodedString(),
188 |             "is_compressed": isCompressed
189 |         ]
190 |         
191 |         // Add expiration time
192 |         if let ttl = ttl {
193 |             let expiresAt = Date().timeIntervalSince1970 + ttl
194 |             cacheEntry["expires_at"] = expiresAt
195 |         }
196 |         
197 |         // Save as JSON
198 |         let entryData = try JSONSerialization.data(withJSONObject: cacheEntry)
199 |         
200 |         // Save the file
201 |         let fileURL = cacheDirectory.appendingPathComponent(key)
202 |         syncQueue.sync {
203 |             do {
204 |                 try entryData.write(to: fileURL)
205 |                 print("Cache item saved to \(fileURL.path)")
206 |             } catch {
207 |                 print("Failed to write cache file: \(error)")
208 |             }
209 |         }
210 |         
211 |         invoke.resolve(EmptyResponse())
212 |     }
213 |     
214 |     @objc public func get(_ invoke: Invoke) throws {
215 |         let args = try invoke.parseArgs(GetRequest.self)
216 |         let key = args.key
217 |         
218 |         let fileURL = cacheDirectory.appendingPathComponent(key)
219 |         
220 |         // Check if file exists
221 |         guard fileManager.fileExists(atPath: fileURL.path) else {
222 |             invoke.resolveNil()
223 |             return
224 |         }
225 |         
226 |         // Read the file
227 |         let data: Data
228 |         do {
229 |             data = try Data(contentsOf: fileURL)
230 |         } catch {
231 |             print("Failed to read cache file: \(error)")
232 |             invoke.resolveNil()
233 |             return
234 |         }
235 |         
236 |         // Parse as JSON
237 |         guard let entryDict = try JSONSerialization.jsonObject(with: data) as? [String: Any] else {
238 |             invoke.resolveNil()
239 |             return
240 |         }
241 |         
242 |         // Check expiration time
243 |         if let expiresAt = entryDict["expires_at"] as? TimeInterval {
244 |             let now = Date().timeIntervalSince1970
245 |             if now > expiresAt {
246 |                 // Item expired, delete it
247 |                 try? fileManager.removeItem(at: fileURL)
248 |                 invoke.resolveNil()
249 |                 return
250 |             }
251 |         }
252 |         
253 |         // Extract value
254 |         guard let valueBase64 = entryDict["value"] as? String,
255 |               let valueData = Data(base64Encoded: valueBase64) else {
256 |             invoke.resolveNil()
257 |             return
258 |         }
259 |         
260 |         // Check if compressed
261 |         let isCompressed = entryDict["is_compressed"] as? Bool ?? false
262 |         
263 |         let finalData: Data
264 |         if isCompressed {
265 |             do {
266 |                 finalData = try decompressData(valueData)
267 |             } catch {
268 |                 print("Failed to decompress data: \(error)")
269 |                 invoke.resolveNil()
270 |                 return
271 |             }
272 |         } else {
273 |             finalData = valueData
274 |         }
275 |         
276 |         // Parse JSON data
277 |         if let jsonObject = try? JSONSerialization.jsonObject(with: finalData),
278 |            let jsonString = String(data: try JSONSerialization.data(withJSONObject: jsonObject), encoding: .utf8) {
279 |             invoke.resolveString(jsonString)
280 |         } else if let stringValue = String(data: finalData, encoding: .utf8) {
281 |             // Accept as direct string
282 |             invoke.resolveString(stringValue)
283 |         } else {
284 |             invoke.resolveNil()
285 |         }
286 |     }
287 |     
288 |     @objc public func has(_ invoke: Invoke) throws {
289 |         let args = try invoke.parseArgs(HasRequest.self)
290 |         let key = args.key
291 |         
292 |         let fileURL = cacheDirectory.appendingPathComponent(key)
293 |         
294 |         // Check if file exists
295 |         guard fileManager.fileExists(atPath: fileURL.path) else {
296 |             invoke.resolve(BooleanResponse(value: false))
297 |             return
298 |         }
299 |         
300 |         // Read file and check validity
301 |         do {
302 |             let data = try Data(contentsOf: fileURL)
303 |             guard let entryDict = try JSONSerialization.jsonObject(with: data) as? [String: Any] else {
304 |                 invoke.resolve(BooleanResponse(value: false))
305 |                 return
306 |             }
307 |             
308 |             // Check expiration time
309 |             if let expiresAt = entryDict["expires_at"] as? TimeInterval {
310 |                 let now = Date().timeIntervalSince1970
311 |                 if now > expiresAt {
312 |                     // Item expired, delete it
313 |                     try? fileManager.removeItem(at: fileURL)
314 |                     invoke.resolve(BooleanResponse(value: false))
315 |                     return
316 |                 }
317 |             }
318 |             
319 |             invoke.resolve(BooleanResponse(value: true))
320 |         } catch {
321 |             // Could not read file
322 |             invoke.resolve(BooleanResponse(value: false))
323 |         }
324 |     }
325 |     
326 |     @objc public func remove(_ invoke: Invoke) throws {
327 |         let args = try invoke.parseArgs(RemoveRequest.self)
328 |         let key = args.key
329 |         
330 |         let fileURL = cacheDirectory.appendingPathComponent(key)
331 |         
332 |         if fileManager.fileExists(atPath: fileURL.path) {
333 |             do {
334 |                 try fileManager.removeItem(at: fileURL)
335 |                 print("Cache item removed: \(key)")
336 |             } catch {
337 |                 print("Failed to remove cache item: \(error)")
338 |             }
339 |         }
340 |         
341 |         invoke.resolve(EmptyResponse())
342 |     }
343 |     
344 |     @objc public func clear(_ invoke: Invoke) throws {
345 |         do {
346 |             let contents = try fileManager.contentsOfDirectory(at: cacheDirectory, includingPropertiesForKeys: nil)
347 |             for fileURL in contents {
348 |                 try fileManager.removeItem(at: fileURL)
349 |             }
350 |             print("Removed \(contents.count) cache items")
351 |         } catch {
352 |             print("Failed to clear cache: \(error)")
353 |         }
354 |         
355 |         invoke.resolve(EmptyResponse())
356 |     }
357 |     
358 |     @objc public func stats(_ invoke: Invoke) throws {
359 |         var totalSize = 0
360 |         var activeSize = 0
361 |         let now = Date().timeIntervalSince1970
362 |         
363 |         do {
364 |             let contents = try fileManager.contentsOfDirectory(at: cacheDirectory, includingPropertiesForKeys: nil)
365 |             totalSize = contents.count
366 |             
367 |             for fileURL in contents {
368 |                 do {
369 |                     let data = try Data(contentsOf: fileURL)
370 |                     if let entryDict = try JSONSerialization.jsonObject(with: data) as? [String: Any] {
371 |                         if let expiresAt = entryDict["expires_at"] as? TimeInterval {
372 |                             if now <= expiresAt {
373 |                                 activeSize += 1
374 |                             }
375 |                         } else {
376 |                             activeSize += 1
377 |                         }
378 |                     }
379 |                 } catch {
380 |                     // Could not read file, skip
381 |                 }
382 |             }
383 |         } catch {
384 |             print("Failed to get stats: \(error)")
385 |         }
386 |         
387 |         invoke.resolve(CacheStats(totalSize: totalSize, activeSize: activeSize))
388 |     }
389 |     
390 |     // MARK: - Helper Methods
391 |     
392 |     // Compression with Zlib
393 |     private func compressWithZlib(data: Data) -> Data {
394 |         var compressedData = Data()
395 |         
396 |         // Compression indicator: 1 = compressed, 1 = Zlib
397 |         compressedData.append(1)
398 |         compressedData.append(1)
399 |         
400 |         // Compress data with Zlib in Swift
401 |         do {
402 |             // Data compression in iOS
403 |             let zlibData = try data.deflated(level: compressionLevel)
404 |             compressedData.append(zlibData)
405 |             
406 |             print("Zlib compressed \(data.count) bytes to \(zlibData.count) bytes")
407 |             return compressedData
408 |         } catch {
409 |             print("Zlib compression error: \(error)")
410 |             // Return uncompressed data in case of simple error
411 |             return data
412 |         }
413 |     }
414 |     
415 |     // Compression with LZMA2 (using PLzmaSDK library)
416 |     private func compressWithLZMA2(data: Data) -> Data {
417 |         var compressedData = Data()
418 |         
419 |         // Memory limitation for very large data
420 |         let maxLzma2Size = 10 * 1024 * 1024 // Don't use for data larger than 10MB
421 |         
422 |         if data.count > maxLzma2Size {
423 |             print("Data too large for LZMA2 compression, using Zlib instead")
424 |             return compressWithZlib(data: data)
425 |         }
426 |         
427 |         // Compression indicator: 1 = compressed, 2 = LZMA2
428 |         compressedData.append(1)
429 |         compressedData.append(2)
430 |         
431 |         do {
432 |             // Create memory output stream to hold compressed data
433 |             let outStream = plzma.OutStream()
434 |             
435 |             // Create encoder with LZMA2 method
436 |             let encoder = plzma.Encoder(outStream: outStream, fileType: .raw, method: .LZMA2)
437 |             
438 |             // Configure compression
439 |             encoder.setCompressionLevel(UInt32(min(9, max(0, compressionLevel))))
440 |             
441 |             // Limit dictionary size for memory efficiency
442 |             let dictSize = min(1024 * 1024, data.count) // Max 1MB dictionary size
443 |             encoder.setProperty(plzma.EncoderPropertyId.dictionarySize, value: UInt32(dictSize))
444 |             
445 |             // Prepare input data
446 |             let inStream = plzma.InStream(data)
447 |             
448 |             // Open encoder
449 |             try encoder.open()
450 |             
451 |             // Add stream for compression
452 |             try encoder.addStream(inStream, path: "data")
453 |             
454 |             // Compress
455 |             try encoder.compress()
456 |             
457 |             // Get compressed data
458 |             let lzmaData = outStream.data
459 |             compressedData.append(lzmaData)
460 |             
461 |             print("LZMA2 compressed \(data.count) bytes to \(lzmaData.count) bytes")
462 |             return compressedData
463 |         } catch {
464 |             print("LZMA2 compression error: \(error)")
465 |             // Fall back to Zlib in case of error
466 |             return compressWithZlib(data: data)
467 |         }
468 |     }
469 |     
470 |     // Decompress data
471 |     private func decompressData(_ data: Data) throws -> Data {
472 |         guard data.count >= 2 else {
473 |             throw PluginError(code: .invalidArgs, message: "Invalid compressed data")
474 |         }
475 |         
476 |         // First byte is compression indicator
477 |         let isCompressed = data[0] == 1
478 |         
479 |         if !isCompressed {
480 |             // Uncompressed data
481 |             return data.subdata(in: 2..<data.count)
482 |         }
483 |         
484 |         // Second byte is compression method
485 |         let method = data[1]
486 |         
487 |         switch method {
488 |         case 1:
489 |             // Zlib decompression
490 |             let zlibData = data.subdata(in: 2..<data.count)
491 |             do {
492 |                 let decompressedData = try zlibData.inflated()
493 |                 return decompressedData
494 |             } catch {
495 |                 throw PluginError(code: .operationFailed, message: "Failed to decompress Zlib data: \(error)")
496 |             }
497 |             
498 |         case 2:
499 |             // LZMA2 decompression
500 |             let lzmaData = data.subdata(in: 2..<data.count)
501 |             do {
502 |                 // Create input stream from compressed data
503 |                 let inStream = plzma.InStream(lzmaData)
504 |                 
505 |                 // Create output stream to hold decompressed data
506 |                 let outStream = plzma.OutStream()
507 |                 
508 |                 // Create decoder
509 |                 let decoder = plzma.Decoder(inStream: inStream, fileType: .raw)
510 |                 
511 |                 // Open decoder
512 |                 try decoder.open()
513 |                 
514 |                 // Decompress first item (we only have one)
515 |                 if let item = try decoder.items().first {
516 |                     try decoder.extractItem(item, outStream: outStream)
517 |                 }
518 |                 
519 |                 // Get decompressed data
520 |                 return outStream.data
521 |             } catch {
522 |                 throw PluginError(code: .operationFailed, message: "Failed to decompress LZMA2 data: \(error)")
523 |             }
524 |             
525 |         default:
526 |             throw PluginError(code: .invalidArgs, message: "Unknown compression method: \(method)")
527 |         }
528 |     }
529 | }
530 | 
531 | // MARK: - Data Extensions
532 | 
533 | extension Data {
534 |     // Zlib compression extension
535 |     func deflated(level: Int = 6) throws -> Data {
536 |         let destSize = self.count / 4 + 1024 // Sufficiently large buffer
537 |         var dest = [UInt8](repeating: 0, count: destSize)
538 |         var destLen = UInt(destSize)
539 |         
540 |         let source = [UInt8](self)
541 |         
542 |         let result = compression_encode_buffer(&dest, destLen, source, UInt(source.count),
543 |                                             nil, COMPRESSION_ZLIB)
544 |         
545 |         if result == 0 {
546 |             throw PluginError(code: .operationFailed, message: "Zlib compression failed")
547 |         }
548 |         
549 |         return Data(dest[0..<Int(destLen)])
550 |     }
551 |     
552 |     // Zlib decompression extension
553 |     func inflated() throws -> Data {
554 |         let destSize = self.count * 4 // Decompressed data is usually larger
555 |         var dest = [UInt8](repeating: 0, count: destSize)
556 |         var destLen = UInt(destSize)
557 |         
558 |         let source = [UInt8](self)
559 |         
560 |         let result = compression_decode_buffer(&dest, destLen, source, UInt(source.count),
561 |                                             nil, COMPRESSION_ZLIB)
562 |         
563 |         if result == 0 {
564 |             throw PluginError(code: .operationFailed, message: "Zlib decompression failed")
565 |         }
566 |         
567 |         return Data(dest[0..<Int(destLen)])
568 |     }
569 | }
570 | 
571 | // MARK: - Plugin Init Function
572 | 
573 | @_cdecl("init_plugin_cache")
574 | func initPlugin() -> Plugin {
575 |     return CachePlugin()
576 | }

/permissions/default.toml:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | [default]
 2 | description = "Default permissions for the cache plugin"
 3 | permissions = ["allow-set", "allow-get", "allow-has", "allow-remove", "allow-clear", "allow-stats"]
 4 | 
 5 | # Permissions for setting cache items
 6 | [allow-set]
 7 | description = "Allows setting data in the cache"
 8 | context = []
 9 | 
10 | # Permissions for getting cache items
11 | [allow-get]
12 | description = "Allows retrieving data from the cache"
13 | context = []
14 | 
15 | # Permissions for checking if cache items exist
16 | [allow-has]
17 | description = "Allows checking if data exists in the cache"
18 | context = []
19 | 
20 | # Permissions for removing cache items
21 | [allow-remove]
22 | description = "Allows removing data from the cache"
23 | context = []
24 | 
25 | # Permissions for clearing all cache items
26 | [allow-clear]
27 | description = "Allows clearing all data from the cache"
28 | context = []
29 | 
30 | # Permissions for getting cache statistics
31 | [allow-stats]
32 | description = "Allows retrieving statistics about the cache"
33 | context = []

 2 | import { join } from 'path'
 3 | import { cwd } from 'process'
 4 | import typescript from '@rollup/plugin-typescript'
 5 | 
 6 | const pkg = JSON.parse(readFileSync(join(cwd(), 'package.json'), 'utf8'))
 7 | 
 8 | export default {
 9 |   input: 'guest-js/index.ts',
10 |   output: [
11 |     {
12 |       file: pkg.exports.import,
13 |       format: 'esm'
14 |     },
15 |     {
16 |       file: pkg.exports.require,
17 |       format: 'cjs'
18 |     }
19 |   ],
20 |   plugins: [
21 |     typescript({
22 |       declaration: true,
23 |       declarationDir: `./${pkg.exports.import.split('/')[1]}`
24 |     })
25 |   ],
26 |   external: [
27 |     /^@tauri-apps\/api/,

29 |     ...Object.keys(pkg.peerDependencies || {})
