--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/commands.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | use tauri::{command, AppHandle, Runtime};
 2 | 
 3 | use crate::models::*;
 4 | use crate::CacheExt;
 5 | use crate::Result;
 6 | 
 7 | /// Set a value in the cache with optional TTL
 8 | #[command]
 9 | pub(crate) async fn set<R: Runtime>(
10 |     app: AppHandle<R>,
11 |     key: String,
12 |     value: serde_json::Value,
13 |     options: Option<SetItemOptions>,
14 | ) -> Result<EmptyResponse> {
15 |     app.cache().set(key, value, options)
16 | }
17 | 
18 | /// Get a value from the cache by key
19 | #[command]
20 | pub(crate) async fn get<R: Runtime>(
21 |     app: AppHandle<R>,
22 |     key: String,
23 | ) -> Result<Option<serde_json::Value>> {
24 |     app.cache().get(&key)
25 | }
26 | 
27 | /// Check if a key exists in the cache and is not expired
28 | #[command]
29 | pub(crate) async fn has<R: Runtime>(app: AppHandle<R>, key: String) -> Result<BooleanResponse> {
30 |     app.cache().has(&key)
31 | }
32 | 
33 | /// Remove a value from the cache
34 | #[command]
35 | pub(crate) async fn remove<R: Runtime>(app: AppHandle<R>, key: String) -> Result<EmptyResponse> {
36 |     app.cache().remove(&key)
37 | }
38 | 
39 | /// Clear all values from the cache
40 | #[command]
41 | pub(crate) async fn clear<R: Runtime>(app: AppHandle<R>) -> Result<EmptyResponse> {
42 |     app.cache().clear()
43 | }
44 | 
45 | /// Get cache statistics
46 | #[command]
47 | pub(crate) async fn stats<R: Runtime>(app: AppHandle<R>) -> Result<CacheStats> {
48 |     #[cfg(desktop)]
49 |     {
50 |         let total_size = app.cache().size()?;
51 |         let active_size = app.cache().active_size()?;
52 |         Ok(CacheStats {
53 |             total_size,
54 |             active_size,
55 |         })
56 |     }
57 | 
58 |     #[cfg(mobile)]
59 |     {
60 |         app.cache().stats()
61 |     }
62 | }
63 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/desktop.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | use base64::{engine::general_purpose::STANDARD, Engine as _};
  2 | use flate2::read::ZlibDecoder;
  3 | use flate2::write::ZlibEncoder;
  4 | use flate2::Compression;
  5 | use serde::{de::DeserializeOwned, Deserialize, Serialize};
  6 | use std::collections::HashMap;
  7 | use std::fs;
  8 | use std::io::{self, BufReader, BufWriter, Read, Write};
  9 | use std::path::PathBuf;
 10 | use std::sync::{Arc, Mutex};
 11 | use std::time::{Duration, SystemTime, UNIX_EPOCH};
 12 | use tauri::{plugin::PluginApi, AppHandle, Runtime};
 13 | use xz2::read::XzDecoder;
 14 | use xz2::write::XzEncoder;
 15 | 
 16 | use crate::models::*;
 17 | use crate::Error;
 18 | 
 19 | // Define a type alias for the complex cache value type
 20 | type CacheValueEntry = (serde_json::Value, Option<u64>);
 21 | type CacheValueMap = HashMap<String, CacheValueEntry>;
 22 | type ThreadSafeCacheMap = Arc<Mutex<CacheValueMap>>;
 23 | 
 24 | // Store the value and its optional expiry time in a single struct for better organization
 25 | #[derive(Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
 26 | struct CacheEntry {
 27 |     value: serde_json::Value,
 28 |     expires_at: Option<u64>,
 29 |     is_compressed: Option<bool>,
 30 | }
 31 | 
 32 | // Initialize the cache with a custom configuration
 33 | pub fn init_with_config<R: Runtime, C: DeserializeOwned>(
 34 |     app: &AppHandle<R>,
 35 |     _api: PluginApi<R, C>,
 36 |     cache_file_path: PathBuf,
 37 |     cleanup_interval: u64,
 38 | ) -> crate::Result<Cache<R>> {
 39 |     let cache = Cache {
 40 |         app: app.clone(),
 41 |         cache_file_path,
 42 |         cleanup_interval,
 43 |         file_mutex: Arc::new(Mutex::new(())),
 44 |         compression: CompressionConfig::default(),
 45 |         value_cache: Arc::new(Mutex::new(HashMap::new())),
 46 |     };
 47 | 
 48 |     // Set up a background task to clean expired entries periodically
 49 |     cache.start_cleanup_task();
 50 | 
 51 |     Ok(cache)
 52 | }
 53 | 
 54 | /// Access to the cache APIs.
 55 | #[allow(dead_code)]
 56 | pub struct Cache<R: Runtime> {
 57 |     app: AppHandle<R>,
 58 |     cache_file_path: PathBuf,
 59 |     cleanup_interval: u64,
 60 |     file_mutex: Arc<Mutex<()>>,
 61 |     compression: CompressionConfig,
 62 |     value_cache: ThreadSafeCacheMap,
 63 | }
 64 | 
 65 | impl<R: Runtime> Cache<R> {
 66 |     /// Start a background task to periodically clean up expired cache entries
 67 |     fn start_cleanup_task(&self) {
 68 |         let file_mutex = self.file_mutex.clone();
 69 |         let value_cache = self.value_cache.clone();
 70 |         let interval = self.cleanup_interval;
 71 |         let cache_file_path = self.cache_file_path.clone();
 72 | 
 73 |         // Use a background thread to periodically clean up expired items
 74 |         std::thread::spawn(move || {
 75 |             loop {
 76 |                 std::thread::sleep(Duration::from_secs(interval));
 77 | 
 78 |                 // Clean up expired entries
 79 |                 let now = SystemTime::now()
 80 |                     .duration_since(UNIX_EPOCH)
 81 |                     .unwrap()
 82 |                     .as_secs();
 83 | 
 84 |                 // Also clean up the in-memory value cache
 85 |                 {
 86 |                     let mut cache = value_cache.lock().unwrap();
 87 |                     let expired_keys: Vec<String> = cache
 88 |                         .iter()
 89 |                         .filter_map(|(key, (_, expires_at))| {
 90 |                             if let Some(expires) = expires_at {
 91 |                                 if *expires < now {
 92 |                                     Some(key.clone())
 93 |                                 } else {
 94 |                                     None
 95 |                                 }
 96 |                             } else {
 97 |                                 None
 98 |                             }
 99 |                         })
100 |                         .collect();
101 | 
102 |                     for key in expired_keys {
103 |                         cache.remove(&key);
104 |                     }
105 |                 }
106 | 
107 |                 // Lock the file for exclusive access
108 |                 let _guard = file_mutex.lock().unwrap();
109 | 
110 |                 // Read the current cache
111 |                 let mut data: HashMap<String, CacheEntry> =
112 |                     match Self::read_from_file(&cache_file_path) {
113 |                         Ok(data) => data,
114 |                         Err(_) => continue, // Skip this cleanup cycle if file cannot be read
115 |                     };
116 | 
117 |                 // Filter out expired entries
118 |                 let expired_keys: Vec<String> = data
119 |                     .iter()
120 |                     .filter_map(|(key, entry)| {
121 |                         if let Some(expires_at) = entry.expires_at {
122 |                             if expires_at < now {
123 |                                 Some(key.clone())
124 |                             } else {
125 |                                 None
126 |                             }
127 |                         } else {
128 |                             None
129 |                         }
130 |                     })
131 |                     .collect();
132 | 
133 |                 let mut modified = false;
134 |                 for key in expired_keys {
135 |                     data.remove(&key);
136 |                     modified = true;
137 |                 }
138 | 
139 |                 // Save to file if cache was modified
140 |                 if modified {
141 |                     let _ = Self::write_to_file(&cache_file_path, &data);
142 |                 }
143 |             }
144 |         });
145 |     }
146 | 
147 |     /// Read cache data from file
148 |     fn read_from_file(path: &PathBuf) -> io::Result<HashMap<String, CacheEntry>> {
149 |         if !path.exists() {
150 |             return Ok(HashMap::new());
151 |         }
152 | 
153 |         let file = fs::File::open(path)?;
154 |         let file_size = file.metadata()?.len();
155 | 
156 |         // For large files, use a buffered reader for better performance
157 |         let mut reader = BufReader::with_capacity(
158 |             std::cmp::min(file_size as usize, 128 * 1024), // 128KB buffer or file size
159 |             file,
160 |         );
161 | 
162 |         let mut contents = String::with_capacity(file_size as usize);
163 |         reader.read_to_string(&mut contents)?;
164 | 
165 |         if contents.is_empty() {
166 |             return Ok(HashMap::new());
167 |         }
168 | 
169 |         match serde_json::from_str(&contents) {
170 |             Ok(data) => Ok(data),
171 |             Err(_) => Ok(HashMap::new()),
172 |         }
173 |     }
174 | 
175 |     /// Write cache data to file
176 |     fn write_to_file(path: &PathBuf, data: &HashMap<String, CacheEntry>) -> io::Result<()> {
177 |         let file = fs::File::create(path)?;
178 | 
179 |         // Use a buffered writer for better performance
180 |         let mut writer = BufWriter::with_capacity(128 * 1024, file); // 128KB buffer
181 | 
182 |         serde_json::to_writer(&mut writer, data)?;
183 |         writer.flush()?;
184 |         Ok(())
185 |     }
186 | 
187 |     /// Compress a JSON value using a specific configuration
188 |     fn compress_value_with_config(
189 |         &self,
190 |         value: &serde_json::Value,
191 |         config: &CompressionConfig,
192 |     ) -> crate::Result<Vec<u8>> {
193 |         // First serialize to JSON string to determine size
194 |         let json_string = serde_json::to_string(value)
195 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to serialize value: {}", e)))?;
196 | 
197 |         // Check if value is below the compression threshold
198 |         if !config.enabled || json_string.len() < config.threshold {
199 |             // Return a special marker that indicates this value wasn't compressed
200 |             let mut result = Vec::with_capacity(json_string.len() + 2);
201 |             result.push(0); // Marker for uncompressed data
202 |             result.push(0); // Method marker (unused for uncompressed)
203 |             result.extend_from_slice(json_string.as_bytes());
204 |             return Ok(result);
205 |         }
206 | 
207 |         // For large data, use chunked processing to avoid memory spikes
208 |         let bytes = json_string.as_bytes();
209 |         const CHUNK_SIZE: usize = 64 * 1024; // 64KB chunks
210 | 
211 |         match config.method {
212 |             CompressionMethod::Zlib => {
213 |                 // Apply Zlib compression with the configured level
214 |                 let zlib_level = Compression::new(config.level);
215 |                 let mut encoder = ZlibEncoder::new(Vec::new(), zlib_level);
216 | 
217 |                 if bytes.len() > CHUNK_SIZE {
218 |                     // Process in chunks for large data
219 |                     for chunk in bytes.chunks(CHUNK_SIZE) {
220 |                         encoder.write_all(chunk).map_err(|e| {
221 |                             Error::Cache(format!("Failed to compress value chunk: {}", e))
222 |                         })?;
223 |                     }
224 |                 } else {
225 |                     // Small data can be written at once
226 |                     encoder
227 |                         .write_all(bytes)
228 |                         .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to compress value: {}", e)))?;
229 |                 }
230 | 
231 |                 // Add marker for compressed data
232 |                 let mut compressed = encoder
233 |                     .finish()
234 |                     .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to finish compression: {}", e)))?;
235 | 
236 |                 // Prepend markers (1 = compressed, 1 = Zlib)
237 |                 let mut result = Vec::with_capacity(compressed.len() + 2);
238 |                 result.push(1); // Compressed marker
239 |                 result.push(1); // Method marker: 1 = Zlib
240 |                 result.append(&mut compressed);
241 | 
242 |                 Ok(result)
243 |             }
244 |             CompressionMethod::Lzma2 => {
245 |                 // Apply LZMA2 compression with the configured level
246 |                 let mut encoder = XzEncoder::new(Vec::new(), config.level);
247 | 
248 |                 if bytes.len() > CHUNK_SIZE {
249 |                     // Process in chunks for large data
250 |                     for chunk in bytes.chunks(CHUNK_SIZE) {
251 |                         encoder.write_all(chunk).map_err(|e| {
252 |                             Error::Cache(format!("Failed to compress value chunk: {}", e))
253 |                         })?;
254 |                     }
255 |                 } else {
256 |                     // Small data can be written at once
257 |                     encoder
258 |                         .write_all(bytes)
259 |                         .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to compress value: {}", e)))?;
260 |                 }
261 | 
262 |                 // Add marker for compressed data
263 |                 let mut compressed = encoder
264 |                     .finish()
265 |                     .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to finish compression: {}", e)))?;
266 | 
267 |                 // Prepend markers (1 = compressed, 2 = LZMA2)
268 |                 let mut result = Vec::with_capacity(compressed.len() + 2);
269 |                 result.push(1); // Compressed marker
270 |                 result.push(2); // Method marker: 2 = LZMA2
271 |                 result.append(&mut compressed);
272 | 
273 |                 Ok(result)
274 |             }
275 |         }
276 |     }
277 | 
278 |     /// Compress a JSON value using the default compression configuration
279 |     #[allow(dead_code)]
280 |     fn compress_value(&self, value: &serde_json::Value) -> crate::Result<Vec<u8>> {
281 |         self.compress_value_with_config(value, &self.compression)
282 |     }
283 | 
284 |     /// Decompress a compressed value back to JSON
285 |     fn decompress_value(&self, data: &[u8]) -> crate::Result<serde_json::Value> {
286 |         if data.is_empty() {
287 |             return Err(Error::Cache(
288 |                 "Empty data provided for decompression".to_string(),
289 |             ));
290 |         }
291 | 
292 |         // First byte indicates if data is compressed
293 |         let is_compressed = data[0] == 1;
294 | 
295 |         if !is_compressed {
296 |             // Data is not compressed - parse the JSON directly
297 |             let json_data = &data[2..]; // Skip the marker bytes
298 | 
299 |             let string_data = std::str::from_utf8(json_data)
300 |                 .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to decode uncompressed data: {}", e)))?;
301 | 
302 |             return serde_json::from_str(string_data)
303 |                 .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to deserialize value: {}", e)));
304 |         }
305 | 
306 |         // Second byte indicates compression method
307 |         let method_marker = data[1];
308 |         let compressed_data = &data[2..]; // Skip the marker bytes
309 | 
310 |         match method_marker {
311 |             1 => {
312 |                 // Zlib decompression
313 |                 let mut decoder = ZlibDecoder::new(compressed_data);
314 |                 let mut json_string = String::new();
315 | 
316 |                 decoder
317 |                     .read_to_string(&mut json_string)
318 |                     .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to decompress Zlib data: {}", e)))?;
319 | 
320 |                 serde_json::from_str(&json_string)
321 |                     .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to parse decompressed JSON: {}", e)))
322 |             }
323 |             2 => {
324 |                 // LZMA2 decompression
325 |                 let mut decoder = XzDecoder::new(compressed_data);
326 |                 let mut json_string = String::new();
327 | 
328 |                 decoder
329 |                     .read_to_string(&mut json_string)
330 |                     .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to decompress LZMA2 data: {}", e)))?;
331 | 
332 |                 serde_json::from_str(&json_string)
333 |                     .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to parse decompressed JSON: {}", e)))
334 |             }
335 |             _ => Err(Error::Cache(format!(
336 |                 "Unknown compression method marker: {}",
337 |                 method_marker
338 |             ))),
339 |         }
340 |     }
341 | 
342 |     /// Sets a value in the cache with an optional TTL
343 |     pub fn set<T: Serialize + std::fmt::Debug>(
344 |         &self,
345 |         key: String,
346 |         value: T,
347 |         options: Option<SetItemOptions>,
348 |     ) -> crate::Result<EmptyResponse> {
349 |         // Serialize the value to JSON first (do this outside the lock)
350 |         let value_json = serde_json::to_value(value)
351 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to serialize value: {}", e)))?;
352 | 
353 |         // Calculate expiration time if TTL is set
354 |         let expires_at = options.as_ref().and_then(|opt| {
355 |             opt.ttl.map(|ttl| {
356 |                 SystemTime::now()
357 |                     .duration_since(UNIX_EPOCH)
358 |                     .unwrap()
359 |                     .as_secs()
360 |                     + ttl
361 |             })
362 |         });
363 | 
364 |         // Update the in-memory cache first
365 |         {
366 |             let mut cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
367 |             cache.insert(key.clone(), (value_json.clone(), expires_at));
368 |         }
369 | 
370 |         // Acquire lock for file operations
371 |         let _guard = self.file_mutex.lock().unwrap();
372 | 
373 |         // Get current cache data
374 |         let mut data = Self::read_from_file(&self.cache_file_path)
375 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to read cache file: {}", e)))?;
376 | 
377 |         // Check if compression is requested
378 |         let should_compress = options
379 |             .as_ref()
380 |             .and_then(|opt| opt.compress)
381 |             .unwrap_or(self.compression.enabled);
382 | 
383 |         // Create a temporary compression config based on options
384 |         let temp_compression = CompressionConfig {
385 |             enabled: should_compress,
386 |             level: self.compression.level,
387 |             threshold: self.compression.threshold,
388 |             method: options
389 |                 .as_ref()
390 |                 .and_then(|opt| opt.compression_method.clone())
391 |                 .unwrap_or(self.compression.method.clone()),
392 |         };
393 | 
394 |         // Process the value based on compression settings
395 |         let entry = if should_compress {
396 |             // Compress the value using the temporary compression config
397 |             let processed_data = self.compress_value_with_config(&value_json, &temp_compression)?;
398 |             // Store the processed data as a base64 string
399 |             let encoded_str = STANDARD.encode(&processed_data);
400 |             CacheEntry {
401 |                 value: serde_json::Value::String(encoded_str),
402 |                 expires_at,
403 |                 is_compressed: Some(true),
404 |             }
405 |         } else {
406 |             CacheEntry {
407 |                 value: value_json,
408 |                 expires_at,
409 |                 is_compressed: Some(false),
410 |             }
411 |         };
412 | 
413 |         // Update the cache
414 |         data.insert(key, entry);
415 | 
416 |         // Save the updated cache to file
417 |         Self::write_to_file(&self.cache_file_path, &data)
418 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to write cache file: {}", e)))?;
419 | 
420 |         Ok(EmptyResponse::default())
421 |     }
422 | 
423 |     /// Gets a value from the cache
424 |     pub fn get(&self, key: &str) -> crate::Result<Option<serde_json::Value>> {
425 |         // First check the in-memory cache
426 |         {
427 |             let cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
428 |             if let Some((value, expires_at)) = cache.get(key) {
429 |                 // Check if expired
430 |                 if let Some(expires) = expires_at {
431 |                     let now = SystemTime::now()
432 |                         .duration_since(UNIX_EPOCH)
433 |                         .unwrap()
434 |                         .as_secs();
435 | 
436 |                     if *expires < now {
437 |                         // Item has expired, remove from in-memory cache
438 |                         drop(cache); // Release the lock before modifying
439 |                         let mut cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
440 |                         cache.remove(key);
441 |                     } else {
442 |                         // Not expired, return the cached value
443 |                         return Ok(Some(value.clone()));
444 |                     }
445 |                 } else {
446 |                     // No expiration, return the cached value
447 |                     return Ok(Some(value.clone()));
448 |                 }
449 |             }
450 |         }
451 | 
452 |         // If not in memory cache, check the file
453 |         // Acquire lock for file operations
454 |         let _guard = self.file_mutex.lock().unwrap();
455 | 
456 |         // Get current cache data
457 |         let data = Self::read_from_file(&self.cache_file_path)
458 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to read cache file: {}", e)))?;
459 | 
460 |         if let Some(entry) = data.get(key) {
461 |             // Check if the item has expired
462 |             if let Some(expires_at) = entry.expires_at {
463 |                 let now = SystemTime::now()
464 |                     .duration_since(UNIX_EPOCH)
465 |                     .unwrap()
466 |                     .as_secs();
467 | 
468 |                 if expires_at < now {
469 |                     // Item has expired
470 |                     return Ok(None);
471 |                 }
472 |             }
473 | 
474 |             // Check if the value is compressed
475 |             if entry.is_compressed.unwrap_or(false) {
476 |                 // Value is compressed - need to decompress
477 |                 if let serde_json::Value::String(compressed_str) = &entry.value {
478 |                     // Decode base64
479 |                     let compressed_data = STANDARD
480 |                         .decode(compressed_str)
481 |                         .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to decode base64: {}", e)))?;
482 | 
483 |                     // Decompress
484 |                     let value = self.decompress_value(&compressed_data)?;
485 | 
486 |                     // Cache the decompressed value in memory for future use
487 |                     {
488 |                         let mut cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
489 |                         cache.insert(key.to_string(), (value.clone(), entry.expires_at));
490 |                     }
491 | 
492 |                     return Ok(Some(value));
493 |                 } else {
494 |                     return Err(Error::Cache(
495 |                         "Compressed value is not in expected format".to_string(),
496 |                     ));
497 |                 }
498 |             }
499 | 
500 |             // Store uncompressed value in memory cache for future use
501 |             {
502 |                 let mut cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
503 |                 cache.insert(key.to_string(), (entry.value.clone(), entry.expires_at));
504 |             }
505 | 
506 |             // Return the value as is (not compressed)
507 |             Ok(Some(entry.value.clone()))
508 |         } else {
509 |             Ok(None)
510 |         }
511 |     }
512 | 
513 |     /// Checks if a key exists in the cache and hasn't expired
514 |     pub fn has(&self, key: &str) -> crate::Result<BooleanResponse> {
515 |         // First check the in-memory cache
516 |         {
517 |             let cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
518 |             if let Some((_, expires_at)) = cache.get(key) {
519 |                 // Check if expired
520 |                 if let Some(expires) = expires_at {
521 |                     let now = SystemTime::now()
522 |                         .duration_since(UNIX_EPOCH)
523 |                         .unwrap()
524 |                         .as_secs();
525 | 
526 |                     if *expires < now {
527 |                         // Item has expired
528 |                         drop(cache); // Release the lock before modifying
529 |                         let mut cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
530 |                         cache.remove(key);
531 |                     } else {
532 |                         // Not expired
533 |                         return Ok(BooleanResponse { value: true });
534 |                     }
535 |                 } else {
536 |                     // No expiration
537 |                     return Ok(BooleanResponse { value: true });
538 |                 }
539 |             }
540 |         }
541 | 
542 |         // Acquire lock for file operations
543 |         let _guard = self.file_mutex.lock().unwrap();
544 | 
545 |         // Get current time
546 |         let now = SystemTime::now()
547 |             .duration_since(UNIX_EPOCH)
548 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(e.to_string()))?
549 |             .as_secs();
550 | 
551 |         // Load data from file
552 |         let data = Self::read_from_file(&self.cache_file_path)
553 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to read cache file: {}", e)))?;
554 | 
555 |         if let Some(entry) = data.get(key) {
556 |             // Check if the entry has expired
557 |             if let Some(expires_at) = entry.expires_at {
558 |                 if expires_at < now {
559 |                     return Ok(BooleanResponse { value: false });
560 |                 }
561 |             }
562 | 
563 |             // Add to memory cache
564 |             {
565 |                 let mut cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
566 |                 cache.insert(key.to_string(), (entry.value.clone(), entry.expires_at));
567 |             }
568 | 
569 |             Ok(BooleanResponse { value: true })
570 |         } else {
571 |             Ok(BooleanResponse { value: false })
572 |         }
573 |     }
574 | 
575 |     /// Removes a value from the cache
576 |     pub fn remove(&self, key: &str) -> crate::Result<EmptyResponse> {
577 |         // Remove from in-memory cache first
578 |         {
579 |             let mut cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
580 |             cache.remove(key);
581 |         }
582 | 
583 |         // Acquire lock for file operations
584 |         let _guard = self.file_mutex.lock().unwrap();
585 | 
586 |         // Load data from file
587 |         let mut data = Self::read_from_file(&self.cache_file_path)
588 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to read cache file: {}", e)))?;
589 | 
590 |         // Remove item if exists
591 |         if data.remove(key).is_some() {
592 |             // Save changes to file
593 |             Self::write_to_file(&self.cache_file_path, &data)
594 |                 .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to write cache file: {}", e)))?;
595 |         }
596 | 
597 |         Ok(EmptyResponse {})
598 |     }
599 | 
600 |     /// Clears the entire cache
601 |     pub fn clear(&self) -> crate::Result<EmptyResponse> {
602 |         // Clear the in-memory cache
603 |         {
604 |             let mut cache = self.value_cache.lock().unwrap();
605 |             cache.clear();
606 |         }
607 | 
608 |         // Acquire lock for file operations
609 |         let _guard = self.file_mutex.lock().unwrap();
610 | 
611 |         // Just write an empty cache
612 |         Self::write_to_file(&self.cache_file_path, &HashMap::new())
613 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to write cache file: {}", e)))?;
614 | 
615 |         Ok(EmptyResponse {})
616 |     }
617 | 
618 |     /// Get the total number of items in the cache
619 |     pub fn size(&self) -> crate::Result<usize> {
620 |         // Acquire lock for file operations
621 |         let _guard = self.file_mutex.lock().unwrap();
622 | 
623 |         // Load data from file
624 |         let data = Self::read_from_file(&self.cache_file_path)
625 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to read cache file: {}", e)))?;
626 | 
627 |         Ok(data.len())
628 |     }
629 | 
630 |     /// Get the number of non-expired items in the cache
631 |     pub fn active_size(&self) -> crate::Result<usize> {
632 |         // Acquire lock for file operations
633 |         let _guard = self.file_mutex.lock().unwrap();
634 | 
635 |         // Load data from file
636 |         let data = Self::read_from_file(&self.cache_file_path)
637 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to read cache file: {}", e)))?;
638 | 
639 |         // Get current time
640 |         let now = SystemTime::now()
641 |             .duration_since(UNIX_EPOCH)
642 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(e.to_string()))?
643 |             .as_secs();
644 | 
645 |         // Count only non-expired items
646 |         let active_count = data
647 |             .iter()
648 |             .filter(|(_, entry)| {
649 |                 if let Some(expires_at) = entry.expires_at {
650 |                     expires_at > now
651 |                 } else {
652 |                     true // Items without expiration are always active
653 |                 }
654 |             })
655 |             .count();
656 | 
657 |         Ok(active_count)
658 |     }
659 | 
660 |     /// Get the path to the cache file
661 |     pub fn get_cache_file_path(&self) -> PathBuf {
662 |         self.cache_file_path.clone()
663 |     }
664 | 
665 |     /// Configure the cache with compression settings
666 |     pub fn init_with_config(
667 |         &mut self,
668 |         default_compression: bool,
669 |         compression_level: Option<u32>,
670 |         threshold: Option<usize>,
671 |         compression_method: Option<CompressionMethod>,
672 |     ) {
673 |         self.compression = CompressionConfig {
674 |             enabled: default_compression,
675 |             level: compression_level.unwrap_or(6),
676 |             threshold: threshold.unwrap_or(COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD),
677 |             method: compression_method.unwrap_or(CompressionMethod::Zlib),
678 |         };
679 |     }
680 | }
681 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/error.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | use serde::{ser::Serializer, Serialize};
 2 | 
 3 | pub type Result<T> = std::result::Result<T, Error>;
 4 | 
 5 | #[derive(Debug, thiserror::Error)]
 6 | pub enum Error {
 7 |     #[error(transparent)]
 8 |     Io(#[from] std::io::Error),
 9 |     #[error(transparent)]
10 |     Json(#[from] serde_json::Error),
11 |     #[error("Cache error: {0}")]
12 |     Cache(String),
13 |     #[cfg(mobile)]
14 |     #[error(transparent)]
15 |     PluginInvoke(#[from] tauri::plugin::mobile::PluginInvokeError),
16 | }
17 | 
18 | impl Serialize for Error {
19 |     fn serialize<S>(&self, serializer: S) -> std::result::Result<S::Ok, S::Error>
20 |     where
21 |         S: Serializer,
22 |     {
23 |         serializer.serialize_str(self.to_string().as_ref())
24 |     }
25 | }
26 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/lib.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | use tauri::{
  2 |     plugin::{Builder, TauriPlugin},
  3 |     Manager, Runtime,
  4 | };
  5 | 
  6 | pub use models::*;
  7 | 
  8 | #[cfg(desktop)]
  9 | mod desktop;
 10 | #[cfg(mobile)]
 11 | mod mobile;
 12 | 
 13 | mod commands;
 14 | mod error;
 15 | mod models;
 16 | 
 17 | pub use error::{Error, Result};
 18 | 
 19 | #[cfg(desktop)]
 20 | use desktop::Cache;
 21 | #[cfg(mobile)]
 22 | use mobile::Cache;
 23 | 
 24 | /// Extensions to [`tauri::App`], [`tauri::AppHandle`] and [`tauri::Window`] to access the cache APIs.
 25 | pub trait CacheExt<R: Runtime> {
 26 |     fn cache(&self) -> &Cache<R>;
 27 | }
 28 | 
 29 | impl<R: Runtime, T: Manager<R>> crate::CacheExt<R> for T {
 30 |     fn cache(&self) -> &Cache<R> {
 31 |         self.state::<Cache<R>>().inner()
 32 |     }
 33 | }
 34 | 
 35 | /// Initializes the plugin.
 36 | pub fn init<R: Runtime>() -> TauriPlugin<R> {
 37 |     // Default config
 38 |     let config = CacheConfig::default();
 39 |     init_with_config(config)
 40 | }
 41 | 
 42 | /// Initializes the plugin with custom configuration.
 43 | pub fn init_with_config<R: Runtime>(config: CacheConfig) -> TauriPlugin<R> {
 44 |     // Clone config for use in the closure
 45 |     let config_clone = config.clone();
 46 | 
 47 |     Builder::new("cache")
 48 |         .invoke_handler(tauri::generate_handler![
 49 |             commands::set,
 50 |             commands::get,
 51 |             commands::has,
 52 |             commands::remove,
 53 |             commands::clear,
 54 |             commands::stats
 55 |         ])
 56 |         .setup(move |app, api| {
 57 |             // Provide the config manually to the desktop implementation
 58 |             #[cfg(desktop)]
 59 |             let cache = {
 60 |                 // Always start from app's cache directory
 61 |                 let base_cache_dir = app.path().app_cache_dir().map_err(|e| {
 62 |                     crate::Error::Cache(format!("Failed to get app cache directory: {}", e))
 63 |                 })?;
 64 | 
 65 |                 // If custom subdirectory is specified, append it to the app cache directory path
 66 |                 let cache_dir = if let Some(custom_dir) = config_clone.cache_dir.as_deref() {
 67 |                     let custom_path = std::path::PathBuf::from(custom_dir);
 68 |                     if custom_path.is_absolute() {
 69 |                         // Instead of absolute path, take only the last component
 70 |                         let path_components: Vec<_> = custom_path
 71 |                             .components()
 72 |                             .filter(|c| !c.as_os_str().is_empty())
 73 |                             .collect();
 74 | 
 75 |                         if let Some(last_component) = path_components.last() {
 76 |                             base_cache_dir.join(last_component.as_os_str())
 77 |                         } else {
 78 |                             base_cache_dir
 79 |                         }
 80 |                     } else {
 81 |                         // Add as a relative path
 82 |                         base_cache_dir.join(custom_dir)
 83 |                     }
 84 |                 } else {
 85 |                     base_cache_dir
 86 |                 };
 87 | 
 88 |                 // Create the cache directory if it doesn't exist
 89 |                 std::fs::create_dir_all(&cache_dir).map_err(|e| {
 90 |                     crate::Error::Cache(format!("Failed to create cache directory: {}", e))
 91 |                 })?;
 92 | 
 93 |                 // Determine the cache file name
 94 |                 let cache_file_name = config_clone
 95 |                     .cache_file_name
 96 |                     .as_deref()
 97 |                     .unwrap_or("tauri_cache.json");
 98 |                 let cache_file_path = cache_dir.join(cache_file_name);
 99 | 
100 |                 // Get the default compression settings
101 |                 let default_compression = config_clone.default_compression.unwrap_or(true);
102 |                 let compression_level = config_clone.compression_level;
103 |                 let compression_threshold = config_clone.compression_threshold;
104 |                 let compression_method = config_clone.compression_method;
105 | 
106 |                 // Initialize the cache with cleanup interval
107 |                 let mut cache = desktop::init_with_config(
108 |                     app,
109 |                     api,
110 |                     cache_file_path,
111 |                     config_clone.cleanup_interval.unwrap_or(60),
112 |                 )?;
113 | 
114 |                 // Initialize with compression settings
115 |                 cache.init_with_config(
116 |                     default_compression,
117 |                     compression_level,
118 |                     compression_threshold,
119 |                     compression_method,
120 |                 );
121 |                 cache
122 |             };
123 | 
124 |             #[cfg(mobile)]
125 |             let cache = {
126 |                 // Always start from app's cache directory
127 |                 let base_cache_dir = app.path().app_cache_dir().map_err(|e| {
128 |                     crate::Error::Cache(format!("Failed to get app cache directory: {}", e))
129 |                 })?;
130 | 
131 |                 // If custom subdirectory is specified, append it to the app cache directory path
132 |                 let cache_dir = if let Some(custom_dir) = config_clone.cache_dir.as_deref() {
133 |                     let custom_path = std::path::PathBuf::from(custom_dir);
134 |                     if custom_path.is_absolute() {
135 |                         // Instead of absolute path, take only the last component
136 |                         let path_components: Vec<_> = custom_path
137 |                             .components()
138 |                             .filter(|c| !c.as_os_str().is_empty())
139 |                             .collect();
140 | 
141 |                         if let Some(last_component) = path_components.last() {
142 |                             base_cache_dir.join(last_component.as_os_str())
143 |                         } else {
144 |                             base_cache_dir
145 |                         }
146 |                     } else {
147 |                         // Add as a relative path
148 |                         base_cache_dir.join(custom_dir)
149 |                     }
150 |                 } else {
151 |                     base_cache_dir
152 |                 };
153 | 
154 |                 // Create the cache directory if it doesn't exist
155 |                 std::fs::create_dir_all(&cache_dir).map_err(|e| {
156 |                     crate::Error::Cache(format!("Failed to create cache directory: {}", e))
157 |                 })?;
158 | 
159 |                 // Determine the cache file name
160 |                 let cache_file_name = config_clone
161 |                     .cache_file_name
162 |                     .as_deref()
163 |                     .unwrap_or("tauri_cache.json");
164 |                 let cache_file_path = cache_dir.join(cache_file_name);
165 | 
166 |                 // Get the default compression settings
167 |                 let default_compression = config_clone.default_compression.unwrap_or(true);
168 |                 let compression_level = config_clone.compression_level;
169 |                 let compression_threshold = config_clone.compression_threshold;
170 |                 let compression_method = config_clone.compression_method;
171 | 
172 |                 // Initialize the cache with cleanup interval
173 |                 let mut cache = mobile::init_with_config(
174 |                     app,
175 |                     api,
176 |                     cache_file_path,
177 |                     config_clone.cleanup_interval.unwrap_or(60),
178 |                 )?;
179 | 
180 |                 // Initialize with compression settings
181 |                 cache.init_with_config(
182 |                     default_compression,
183 |                     compression_level,
184 |                     compression_threshold,
185 |                     compression_method,
186 |                 );
187 |                 cache
188 |             };
189 | 
190 |             app.manage(cache);
191 |             Ok(())
192 |         })
193 |         .build()
194 | }
195 |

/src/mobile.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | use serde::{de::DeserializeOwned, Serialize};
  2 | use std::path::PathBuf;
  3 | use tauri::{
  4 |     plugin::{PluginApi, PluginHandle},
  5 |     AppHandle, Runtime,
  6 | };
  7 | 
  8 | use crate::models::*;
  9 | use crate::Error;
 10 | 
 11 | #[cfg(target_os = "ios")]
 12 | tauri::ios_plugin_binding!(init_plugin_cache);
 13 | 
 14 | // initializes the Kotlin or Swift plugin classes
 15 | pub fn init<R: Runtime, C: DeserializeOwned>(
 16 |     _app: &AppHandle<R>,
 17 |     api: PluginApi<R, C>,
 18 | ) -> crate::Result<Cache<R>> {
 19 |     #[cfg(target_os = "android")]
 20 |     let handle = api.register_android_plugin("app.tauri.plugin.cache", "CachePlugin")?;
 21 |     #[cfg(target_os = "ios")]
 22 |     let handle = api.register_ios_plugin(init_plugin_cache)?;
 23 |     Ok(Cache(handle))
 24 | }
 25 | 
 26 | // Initialize the plugin with a custom cache file path
 27 | pub fn init_with_config<R: Runtime, C: DeserializeOwned>(
 28 |     _app: &AppHandle<R>,
 29 |     api: PluginApi<R, C>,
 30 |     cache_file_path: PathBuf,
 31 |     cleanup_interval: u64,
 32 | ) -> crate::Result<Cache<R>> {
 33 |     // Create config for mobile platforms
 34 |     let config = CacheConfig {
 35 |         cache_dir: cache_file_path
 36 |             .parent()
 37 |             .map(|p| p.to_string_lossy().to_string()),
 38 |         cache_file_name: cache_file_path
 39 |             .file_name()
 40 |             .map(|f| f.to_string_lossy().to_string()),
 41 |         cleanup_interval: Some(cleanup_interval),
 42 |         default_compression: Some(true),
 43 |         compression_level: Some(6),
 44 |         compression_threshold: Some(crate::models::COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD),
 45 |         compression_method: Some(CompressionMethod::Zlib),
 46 |     };
 47 | 
 48 |     // Register the plugin with API
 49 |     #[cfg(target_os = "android")]
 50 |     let handle = {
 51 |         // Pass configuration to Android
 52 |         let config_json = serde_json::to_string(&config)
 53 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to serialize config: {}", e)))?;
 54 | 
 55 |         // Register the plugin
 56 |         let handle = api
 57 |             .register_android_plugin("app.tauri.plugin.cache", "CachePlugin")
 58 |             .map_err(|e| Error::Cache(format!("Failed to register Android plugin: {}", e)))?;
 59 | 
 60 |         // If registration successful, send configuration through method call
 61 |         if let Err(e) = handle.run_mobile_plugin::<String>("configure", config_json) {
 62 |             // Log the error but continue
 63 |             eprintln!("Warning: Failed to configure Android cache plugin: {}", e);
 64 |         }
 65 | 
 66 |         handle
 67 |     };
 68 | 
 69 |     #[cfg(target_os = "ios")]
 70 |     let handle = {
 71 |         // Pass configuration to iOS
 72 |         let config_json = serde_json::to_string(&config).unwrap_or_default();
 73 |         api.register_ios_plugin_with_config(init_plugin_cache, config_json)?
 74 |     };
 75 | 
 76 |     Ok(Cache(handle))
 77 | }
 78 | 
 79 | /// Access to the cache APIs.
 80 | pub struct Cache<R: Runtime>(PluginHandle<R>);
 81 | 
 82 | impl<R: Runtime> Cache<R> {
 83 |     /// Configure the cache with compression settings
 84 |     pub fn init_with_config(
 85 |         &mut self,
 86 |         default_compression: bool,
 87 |         compression_level: Option<u32>,
 88 |         compression_threshold: Option<usize>,
 89 |         compression_method: Option<CompressionMethod>,
 90 |     ) {
 91 |         // Update compression settings on mobile side
 92 |         // Let's update the config to send these settings to the native side
 93 |         let config = CompressionConfig {
 94 |             enabled: default_compression,
 95 |             level: compression_level.unwrap_or(6),
 96 |             threshold: compression_threshold.unwrap_or(crate::models::COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD),
 97 |             method: compression_method.unwrap_or(CompressionMethod::Zlib),
 98 |         };
 99 | 
100 |         // Send configuration to native side
101 |         let _ = self
102 |             .0
103 |             .run_mobile_plugin::<EmptyResponse>("updateCompressionConfig", config);
104 |         // Error is ignored because this feature might not exist in older versions of mobile plugins
105 |         // Error handling should be added in a real application
106 |     }
107 | 
108 |     /// Sets a value in the cache with optional TTL
109 |     pub fn set<T: Serialize + DeserializeOwned + std::fmt::Debug>(
110 |         &self,
111 |         key: String,
112 |         value: T,
113 |         options: Option<SetItemOptions>,
114 |     ) -> crate::Result<EmptyResponse> {
115 |         let request = SetRequest::<T> {
116 |             key,
117 |             value,
118 |             options,
119 |         };
120 |         self.0
121 |             .run_mobile_plugin::<EmptyResponse>("set", request)
122 |             .map_err(|e| crate::Error::PluginInvoke(e))
123 |     }
124 | 
125 |     /// Gets a value from the cache
126 |     pub fn get(&self, key: &str) -> crate::Result<Option<serde_json::Value>> {
127 |         let request = GetRequest {
128 |             key: key.to_string(),
129 |         };
130 |         self.0
131 |             .run_mobile_plugin::<Option<serde_json::Value>>("get", request)
132 |             .map_err(|e| crate::Error::PluginInvoke(e))
133 |     }
134 | 
135 |     /// Checks if a key exists in the cache
136 |     pub fn has(&self, key: &str) -> crate::Result<BooleanResponse> {
137 |         let request = HasRequest {
138 |             key: key.to_string(),
139 |         };
140 |         self.0
141 |             .run_mobile_plugin::<BooleanResponse>("has", request)
142 |             .map_err(|e| crate::Error::PluginInvoke(e))
143 |     }
144 | 
145 |     /// Removes a value from the cache
146 |     pub fn remove(&self, key: &str) -> crate::Result<EmptyResponse> {
147 |         let request = RemoveRequest {
148 |             key: key.to_string(),
149 |         };
150 |         self.0
151 |             .run_mobile_plugin::<EmptyResponse>("remove", request)
152 |             .map_err(|e| crate::Error::PluginInvoke(e))
153 |     }
154 | 
155 |     /// Clears all values from the cache
156 |     pub fn clear(&self) -> crate::Result<EmptyResponse> {
157 |         self.0
158 |             .run_mobile_plugin::<EmptyResponse>("clear", ())
159 |             .map_err(|e| crate::Error::PluginInvoke(e))
160 |     }
161 | 
162 |     /// Get cache statistics
163 |     pub fn stats(&self) -> crate::Result<CacheStats> {
164 |         self.0
165 |             .run_mobile_plugin::<CacheStats>("stats", ())
166 |             .map_err(|e| crate::Error::PluginInvoke(e))
167 |     }
168 | }
169 |

/src/models.rs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | use serde::{de::DeserializeOwned, Deserialize, Serialize};
  2 | 
  3 | // The size threshold in bytes after which compression will be applied
  4 | pub const COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD: usize = 1024; // 1KB
  5 | 
  6 | /// Supported compression methods
  7 | #[derive(Clone, Serialize, Deserialize, Debug, PartialEq)]
  8 | #[serde(rename_all = "lowercase")]
  9 | pub enum CompressionMethod {
 10 |     /// Zlib compression (default, balanced speed/ratio)
 11 |     Zlib,
 12 |     /// LZMA2 compression (better compression ratio, slower)
 13 |     Lzma2,
 14 | }
 15 | 
 16 | impl Default for CompressionMethod {
 17 |     fn default() -> Self {
 18 |         Self::Zlib
 19 |     }
 20 | }
 21 | 
 22 | /// Options for setting an item in the cache
 23 | #[derive(Debug, Clone, Deserialize, Serialize)]
 24 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
 25 | pub struct SetItemOptions {
 26 |     /// Time-to-live in seconds
 27 |     pub ttl: Option<u64>,
 28 |     /// Whether to compress the data before storing
 29 |     pub compress: Option<bool>,
 30 |     /// Compression method to use (overrides default)
 31 |     pub compression_method: Option<CompressionMethod>,
 32 | }
 33 | 
 34 | /// A cache item with its value and expiration time
 35 | #[derive(Debug, Clone, Deserialize, Serialize)]
 36 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
 37 | pub struct CacheItem<T> {
 38 |     /// The stored value
 39 |     pub value: T,
 40 |     /// Unix timestamp in seconds when this item expires (if applicable)
 41 |     pub expires_at: Option<u64>,
 42 |     /// Whether the data is compressed
 43 |     pub is_compressed: Option<bool>,
 44 | }
 45 | 
 46 | /// Request to set an item in the cache
 47 | #[derive(Debug, Serialize)]
 48 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
 49 | pub struct SetRequest<T>
 50 | where
 51 |     T: Serialize + DeserializeOwned,
 52 | {
 53 |     /// The key to store the value under
 54 |     pub key: String,
 55 |     /// The value to store
 56 |     pub value: T,
 57 |     /// Options for this cache item
 58 |     pub options: Option<SetItemOptions>,
 59 | }
 60 | 
 61 | impl<'de, T> serde::Deserialize<'de> for SetRequest<T>
 62 | where
 63 |     T: Serialize + DeserializeOwned,
 64 | {
 65 |     fn deserialize<D>(deserializer: D) -> std::result::Result<Self, D::Error>
 66 |     where
 67 |         D: serde::Deserializer<'de>,
 68 |     {
 69 |         #[derive(Deserialize)]
 70 |         struct Helper {
 71 |             key: String,
 72 |             value: serde_json::Value,
 73 |             options: Option<SetItemOptions>,
 74 |         }
 75 | 
 76 |         let helper = Helper::deserialize(deserializer)?;
 77 | 
 78 |         let value = serde_json::from_value(helper.value).map_err(serde::de::Error::custom)?;
 79 | 
 80 |         Ok(SetRequest {
 81 |             key: helper.key,
 82 |             value,
 83 |             options: helper.options,
 84 |         })
 85 |     }
 86 | }
 87 | 
 88 | /// Request to get an item from the cache
 89 | #[derive(Debug, Deserialize, Serialize)]
 90 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
 91 | pub struct GetRequest {
 92 |     /// The key to retrieve
 93 |     pub key: String,
 94 | }
 95 | 
 96 | /// Request to remove an item from the cache
 97 | #[derive(Debug, Deserialize, Serialize)]
 98 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
 99 | pub struct RemoveRequest {
100 |     /// The key to remove
101 |     pub key: String,
102 | }
103 | 
104 | /// Request to check if an item exists in the cache
105 | #[derive(Debug, Deserialize, Serialize)]
106 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
107 | pub struct HasRequest {
108 |     /// The key to check
109 |     pub key: String,
110 | }
111 | 
112 | /// Enhanced statistics about the cache
113 | #[derive(Debug, Clone, Default, Deserialize, Serialize)]
114 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
115 | pub struct CacheStats {
116 |     /// Total number of items in the cache (including expired items that haven't been cleaned up yet)
117 |     pub total_size: usize,
118 |     /// Number of active (non-expired) items in the cache
119 |     pub active_size: usize,
120 | }
121 | 
122 | /// Response containing a boolean value
123 | #[derive(Debug, Clone, Default, Deserialize, Serialize)]
124 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
125 | pub struct BooleanResponse {
126 |     /// The boolean value
127 |     pub value: bool,
128 | }
129 | 
130 | /// Empty response for operations that don't return a value
131 | #[derive(Debug, Clone, Default, Deserialize, Serialize)]
132 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
133 | pub struct EmptyResponse {}
134 | 
135 | /// Enhanced configuration for cache compression
136 | #[derive(Clone, Serialize, Deserialize, Debug)]
137 | pub struct CompressionConfig {
138 |     /// Enable or disable compression
139 |     pub enabled: bool,
140 |     /// Compression level (0-9, where 0 is no compression and 9 is max compression)
141 |     pub level: u32,
142 |     /// Threshold in bytes after which compression is applied
143 |     pub threshold: usize,
144 |     /// Compression method to use
145 |     pub method: CompressionMethod,
146 | }
147 | 
148 | impl Default for CompressionConfig {
149 |     fn default() -> Self {
150 |         Self {
151 |             enabled: false,
152 |             level: 6, // Default compression level
153 |             threshold: COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD,
154 |             method: CompressionMethod::Zlib,
155 |         }
156 |     }
157 | }
158 | 
159 | /// Configuration options for the cache plugin
160 | #[derive(Debug, Clone, Deserialize, Serialize)]
161 | #[serde(rename_all = "camelCase")]
162 | pub struct CacheConfig {
163 |     /// Custom directory path for storing cache files
164 |     pub cache_dir: Option<String>,
165 |     /// Custom file name for the cache file
166 |     pub cache_file_name: Option<String>,
167 |     /// Cleanup interval in seconds
168 |     pub cleanup_interval: Option<u64>,
169 |     /// Default compression setting for new items
170 |     pub default_compression: Option<bool>,
171 |     /// Compression level (0-9, where 0 is no compression and 9 is max compression)
172 |     pub compression_level: Option<u32>,
173 |     /// Threshold in bytes after which compression is applied
174 |     pub compression_threshold: Option<usize>,
175 |     /// Compression method to use (zlib or lzma2)
176 |     pub compression_method: Option<CompressionMethod>,
177 | }
178 | 
179 | impl Default for CacheConfig {
180 |     fn default() -> Self {
181 |         Self {
182 |             cache_dir: None,
183 |             cache_file_name: None,
184 |             cleanup_interval: Some(60),        // Default 60 seconds
185 |             default_compression: Some(true),   // Default compression enabled
186 |             compression_level: Some(6),        // Default medium compression level
187 |             compression_threshold: Some(1024), // Default 1KB threshold
188 |             compression_method: Some(CompressionMethod::Zlib), // Default to Zlib
189 |         }
190 |     }
191 | }
192 |
